title: Data Visualization Analyst - Collective Intelligence
industries: Public Relations and Communications
description:
About Brunswick

Brunswick is a strategic advisory firm focused on critical issues. Our purpose is to help the great value-creating organizations of the world play a more successful role in society.

We advise on critical issues at the center of business, politics and society, and help our clients – the leaders of large, complex organizations – understand and navigate these interconnected worlds. Brunswick is one firm globally, operating as a single profit center. This allows us to respond seamlessly and effectively to clients’ needs wherever they are in the world.

Brunswick Group Inclusion and Diversity Statement

Maintaining and strengthening a diverse workforce and inclusive workplace are pillars of Brunswick’s culture and key to our future success. Valuing and supporting every colleague as an individual while helping them reach their full potential is critical to attracting and developing our greatest strength – our people. By embracing our differences and diverse perspectives we create richer experiences within our firm and enhance the quality of the ideas and advice that we deliver to our clients.

Background

Founded in London in 1987, Brunswick’s global partnership has grown organically to 27 offices in 18 countries. We began as a M&A and financial communications firm and, over time, expanded our capabilities and expertise to crisis communications and communications on other business critical issues. We invested in new offices, sectors and a wider variety of offers for clients such as public and regulatory affairs, major litigation, business and society, cyber, employee engagement and digital. Our in-house creative agency, Merchant Cantos, delivers creative, visual content for clients.

We rank number 1 in the world over the last five years by global deal value and global deal volume and were named Band 1 advisors in the U.S. and the UK earlier this year by Chambers and Partners, the legal rankings service, as one of the very top communications firms offering legal and litigation support work. Our CEO is Neal Wolin, based in Washington, D.C. Our Chairman is Sir Alan Parker, based in London.

The Americas

In the U.S., we have offices in Chicago, Dallas, New York, San Francisco and Washington, D.C. In Brazil, we have an office in Sao Paulo. We advise clients on, among other things, domestic and cross border M&A, IPOs, activism, capital markets and investor relations, public and regulatory affairs, geopolitical issues, litigation, crisis, cyber, employee engagement, digital, opinion research and on broader reputation campaigns.

Colleagues in the U.S. are drawn from a variety of backgrounds and consist of in-depth industry and sector experts from banking, law, accounting, politics, government, journalism and the media, consulting and elsewhere. Our U.S. CEO is Nik Deogun.

Data Visualization Analyst – Collective Intelligence

Opportunity

As the lead Data Visualization Analyst for Brunswick’s content brand, CI, you will be responsible for collaborating with the entire firm to generate ideas and turn data into compelling visual insights for clients globally. CI will be a new division within Brunswick, focused on bringing the outside in for our clients, and demonstrating the best of Brunswick’s thinking and capabilities. Your role will be to gather and organize data, using all of Brunswick’s resources, to help our clients understand and solve their most critical issues. This role will require an entrepreneurial spirit, wide-ranging curiosity about Brunswick’s work, enthusiasm to engage with people and ideas around the world, and the ability to explain complex ideas clearly. You will report to the Group Head of Content in New York and work closely with Brunswick’s leadership across the entire firm.

Duties & Responsibilities

Work with client and research teams globally to understand issues and identify data sources.
Use the latest software (Tableau, Looker etc.) to turn data into visual insights.
Generate original ideas for presenting data to provoke thinking and generate business.
Collaborate extensively with non-technical and technical people to create content.
Engage intellectually with firm’s work in multiple sectors and regions.
Demonstrate a strong aesthetic sense for presenting complex ideas.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Technical experience working with data, including familiarity with SQL, Python and JavaScript.
Experience with data visualization and interface design.
Know how to develop and maintain clean, well-organized. and consistent data.
Empathy with different kinds of users and their relationships to technology and data.
Ability to work in a global firm.
Knowledge of the newest trends and developments in data presentation.
Intellectually enthused by Brunswick’s work, clients, and strategic ambitions.
Show more Show less

title: Data Product Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Internet Publishing
description:
Who We Are And What We Do

Momentive (NASDAQ: MNTV) (formerly SurveyMonkey) is a leader in agile experience management, delivering powerful, purpose-built solutions that bring together the best parts of humanity and technology to redefine AI. Momentive products, including GetFeedback, SurveyMonkey, and its brand and market insights solutions, empower decision-makers at 345,000 organizations worldwide to shape exceptional experiences. More than 20 million active users rely on Momentive to fuel market insights, brand insights, employee experience, customer experience, and product experience. Ultimately, the company's vision is to raise the bar for human experiences by amplifying individual voices. Learn more at Momentive.ai.

More about our Business Intelligence Team

We sit on top of a mountain of data here at SurveyMonkey - behavioral, experimentation, transactional, and user level. Our Data Product Team needs an experienced analyst to extract insights. The Data Product Analyst will help point the team towards areas of opportunity and, as a result, directly influence the direction of our products. You will report to the Director of Business Intelligence.

What we're looking for

You will have a place at the product strategy table and will help build data products to answer important questions. You will apply to identify data needs. You will use your expertise in quantitative analysis, data visualization and data-mining to tell the story behind the numbers and obtain relevant insights. Your work will directly improve SurveyMonkey's product strategy including product positioning, pricing & packaging. The skills required are specialized, so experience in a Product focused customer insights role is desirable.

You will

Think from both the user's and business point of view.
Are curious, ask lots of questions and are eager to understand user behaviors and think about long-term trends.
Spot trends and help make informed decisions based on data, generating valuable recommendations that help us build our products further.
Work with multiple teams to provide inputs towards short- term/long-term planning and prioritization.
Can enhance and challenge using data.
Build clear visualizations to allow partners to self serve for their data needs
Communicate the results of complex analyses with both technical and non-technical audiences



You have

Qualifications

3+ years of experience in quantitative analysis
High degree of comfort using SQL
Experience using common visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Sisense or similar)
Experience with challenges that involve complex problems and provide solutions
Proficient in accessing cloud data warehouses (Snowflake, Redshift, Airflow, and proprietary equivalents)
Familiarity with R or Python
Degree in quantitative or computational field.



What we offer our employees

Momentive is a place where the curious come to grow and shape what's next. By embedding inclusion into our processes, policies, and culture for our 1,400+ employees across North America, Europe, and APAC, we're building a workplace where people of every background can excel. We've won multiple awards and received recognition for our forward-looking policies, including extended parental and bereavement leave, vendor benefits standards, and Take 4 sabbaticals.

Momentive is featured as a Glassdoor 2021 Best Place to Work and National Capital Region's Top Employer in Canada (2021). In 2020, Momentive was recognized as a top place to work by Glassdoor Best Places to Work, Fortune Best Places to Work in the Bay Area, Parity.org's Best Companies for Women to Advance, and National Capital Region's Top Employers in Canada. Momentive has consistently been recognized by Great Place to Work® and Fortune as a top workplace since 2018, and we have also won numerous awards as a leader in global survey software, including being named among the G2 Best Software Companies, CNBC's Disruptor 50, and the Forbes Cloud 100.

Our commitment to an inclusive workplace

Momentive is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We celebrate the unique differences of our employees because that is what drives curiosity, innovation, and the success of our business. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information, political affiliation, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities.

Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts here.

title: Portfolio Analyst & Quantitative Modeler - Asset & Liability Management Associate
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. As a Portfolio Analyst and Quantitative Modeler Associate within PNC's ALM Investments - Portfolio Management organization, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA or NYC, NY.

ALM Investments manages PNC’s over $100+ billion dollar fixed income and derivatives portfolio. This represents about 20% of PNC Bank’s total assets

This role has exposure to portfolio management and monitoring: Credit and trade analysis across multiple fixed income sectors

Total return focus managing PNC’s portfolio versus and index
Credit model development and maintenance
Database management and analysis

We Are Looking For a Candidate With The Following

Strong quantitative modeling skills

Programming experience preferred; Python highly preferred.

Large data management experience is a plus.

General knowledge of fixed income securities or mortgage loan mechanics preferred.

Job Description

Using independent judgment and discretion, assists in performing transaction and portfolio level analysis, conducting research and preparing reports. Performs due diligence and statistical analysis related to portfolio management.
Analyzes and understands financial instruments for the bank's investment portfolio, including research and collection of relevant information based on independent judgment.
Develops and maintains management reports that help the group meet their goals and directives. These reports are used for internal management to help establish the risk position of the organization.
Administers and performs defined processes and procedures.
Develops a practical understanding of markets and macroeconomics to be used in analysis of the ALM function.

PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:

Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.

Competencies

Accuracy and Attention to Detail – Understanding of the necessity and value of accuracy and attention to detail; ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.

Asset and Liability Management (ALM) – Knowledge of asset and liability tools, techniques and business practices; ability to manage, measure, and monitor risks associated with assets and liabilities.

Business Acumen – Knowledge, insight, and understanding of business concepts, tools, and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.

Derivatives – Knowledge of the structure, attributes, uses, terminology and processing of basic derivatives, and ability to use them appropriately.

Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.

Financial Analysis – Knowledge of and ability to read, interpret and draw accurate conclusions from financial and numerical material.

Industry Knowledge – Knowledge of the organization's industry group, trends, directions, major issues, regulatory considerations, and trendsetters; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.

Investment Performance Measurement – Knowledge of and ability to utilize a variety of methods to measure the investment performance on a particular portfolio against industry benchmarks and related parameters.

Investment Reporting – Knowledge of and ability to use methods, processes, and tools for creating and maintaining accurate and thorough investment reports.

Pricing Models and Analytics – Knowledge of pricing tools, techniques and methods; ability to assess analytical and pricing models through the use of statistical principles.

Work Experience

Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree, with 2+ years of relevant professional experience. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered.

Education

Bachelors

Benefits

Additional Job Description

PNC offers employees a comprehensive range of benefits to help meet your needs now and in the future. Depending on your eligibility, options for full-time employees include medical/prescription drug coverage (with a Health Savings Account feature); dental and vision options; employee and spouse/child life insurance; short- and long-term disability protection; maternity and parental leave; paid holidays, vacation days and occasional absence time; 401(k), pension and stock purchase plans; dependent care reimbursement account; back-up child/elder care; adoption assistance; educational assistance and a robust wellness program with financial incentives. To learn more about these and other programs, including benefits for part-time employees, visit pncbenefits.com > New to PNC.

Disability Accommodations Statement

The PNC workplace is inclusive and supportive of individual needs. If you have a physical or other impairment that might require an accommodation, including technical assistance with the PNC Careers website or submission process, please call 877-968-7762 and select Option 4: Recruiting or contact us via email at pathfinder@pnc.com.

The Human Resources Service Center hours of operation are Monday - Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM ET.

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO)

PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.

California Residents

Refer to the California Consumer Privacy Act Privacy Notice to gain understanding of how PNC may use or disclose your personal information in our hiring practices.

title: Quantitative Risk Analyst
industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking
description:
Overview:

Perform advanced data and statistical analysis in support of the creation and maintenance of statistical models, including Regression and Multivariate models. Support Senior Analysts and Managers in data analysis and model construction.

Primary Responsibilities:

Assist in establishing, monitoring, evaluating and interpreting data with a risk management focus with an understanding of business strategy.
Develop and maintain working knowledge of Credit Risk databases to provide data and analytical support to Senior Management.

title: Quantitative QA Analyst
industries: Financial Services
description:
Job Purpose

Intercontinental Exchange is looking for a Quantitative QA Analyst to be a part of our team. This role resides within the Clearing Technology segment of ICE. Clearing technology provides automation of risk management and modeling to ensure that markets can operate rapidly and efficiently while minimizing the likelihood of adverse outcomes during market volatility. The Quantitative QA role brings expertise in financial mathematics and technology to the clearing technology group.




You must be results-oriented, self-motivated and have the ability to thrive in a fast-pace environment. This role requires frequent interaction with project managers, developers, product managers, and risk management/quantitative analysts in order to ensure that we deliver a quality clearing house risk platform to our users. Analytical skills and the ability to understand and test quantitative risk assessment/margin calculation models are crucial for the role.




Responsibilities

Develop reference implementations for testing platform applications, based on technical business requirements
Review technical requirements with quantitative models terminology to produce test strategies, test scenarios, and test cases
Implement, maintain, and troubleshoot test harnesses, including implementations for various quantitative models
Define test scenarios and develop/maintain automated test cases
Create test plans, defining test scope, resources, dependencies, risks, and the overall strategy for testing complex software systems
Perform all aspects of verification, including functional, regression, system, and integration testing for applications designed using multi-tiered-based architecture
Deploy application builds and maintain test environments
Perform troubleshooting of software / hardware configuration problems
Demonstrate a passion for finding software bugs in complex algorithms




Qualifications

M.S. or higher in a Financial Engineering, Mathematics, or Computer Science related discipline
Experience with modeling/statistical analysis tools such as Python, R, or MATLAB
Ability to implement quantitative algorithms and develop automated tests using a scripting/programming language
Ability to write and execute customized SQL queries against Oracle DB
Ability to calculate customized statistics on large sets of data
Ability to understand use Python code and spreadsheets containing financial engineering formulas
Must have understanding of derivatives markets and options/asset pricing models
Must be comfortable with working across systems in a high tech software development environment
Progress toward CFA, FRM, or similar credentials a plus
2+ years’ experience with commodity markets, financial trading environment, or equity brokerage business and exposure to futures markets is a plus
Value at Risk (VaR), parametric, Historical Simulation, or other portfolio risk management understanding a plus
Must have excellent communication skills

title: STATISTICAL PROGRAMMER ANALYST
industries: Research Services, Wellness and Fitness Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
At Moffitt Cancer Center, we come face-to-face with cancer every day, but we also see courage. And it inspires us to be the safest and best place for cancer care – to bring greater hope to every patient we serve. It’s why we’ve been continually named One of the Top Places to Work in the Tampa Bay Area. As the only National Cancer Institute-designated Comprehensive Cancer Center based in Florida, Moffitt employs some of the best and brightest minds from around the world. Moffitt is the leading cancer hospital in both Florida and the Southeast and has been nationally ranked by U.S. News & World Report since 1999. Because working at Moffitt is both a career and a mission: to contribute to the prevention and cure of cancer. Join a dedicated, diverse and inclusive team of over 7,000 to be a part of the Courageous future we envision.

Summary

The Statistical Programmer Analyst performs data cleaning, manipulation, and management, and basic level statistical analysis and programming for clinical trials and/or research projects with guidance from more senior biostatisticians (faculty or non-faculty). Experienced in programming using SAS and R for data management and analyses. Proven written and oral communication skills are essential.

An Overview Of The Role

With appropriate guidance, prepares data management plans. Independently cleans and manages data, and analysis of basic data requests.
Creates cleaned datasets using SAS and R; combines multiple disparate raw databases and derives analysis variables accurately. Uses basic SAS and R procedures and options and programs with increasing efficiency. Writes own SAS and R code, finds errors, corrects, and validates data quality and results.
Collaborates and communicates effectively with a variety of types of individuals: programmers, biostatisticians (both junior and senior), and medical personnel.
Demonstrates understanding of basic data collection processes and data sets and shares knowledge with collaborators, fellow biostatisticians, and other team members.

The Ideal Candidate Will Demonstrate

1 year of statistical programming experience in the process of data management.
Experience programming in SAS and R.
A Bachelor’s Degree in Biostatistics, bioinformatics, data science, or other data-analysis related field.

Preferred

2 years of statistical programming experience in the process of data management. Experience with cancer or other health-related data.
A Master’s Degree in Biostatistics, bioinformatics, data science, or other data-analysis related field.

title: Data Privacy Analyst/Project Coordinator
description:
Position: Data Privacy Analyst/Project Coordinator

Benefits: Salary, Health insurance and 401K

Location: Northern Virginia, Hybrid or Remote







Achieved Compliance Solutions is a growing and dynamic service provider of data privacy solutions and services. We provide long-term, outsourced data privacy office functions to corporate entities and research institutions with complex, global data privacy issues. Our clients are active in 60+ jurisdictions, and so is Achieved!  Clients have appointed us as their official data protection officer in dozens of jurisdictions, including the Republic of Ireland, the UK, France, South Africa, Brazil, and Nigeria. Achieved's mission is to ensure each client exceeds the requirements of best practices, regulations, and ethics in each of the jurisdictions in which they engage. 




When joining the Achieved Compliance team, you will gain a world-view of data privacy and significant experience working intimately with the practical operations of organizations. You will grow through substantial opportunities to work with several clients on a virtual secondment-basis in operational, temporary assignments – all while receiving world-class training as an Achieved Compliance consultant. This position is a truly unique opportunity.




Achieved has a growing practice focused on the life sciences and, in particular, entities conducting global research, clinical trials, or support for the same, including health-tech and international logistics and distribution of products. The successful candidate is likely to gain experience implementing a complete privacy program across 3000+ international health research programs, working daily with a committed and world-class internal team. A demonstrated interest in the life sciences and health sectors is preferred but not necessary.




We are looking for curious, communicative, and energetic individuals committed to developing themselves and learning new skills. Based in Northern Virginia's technology hub, we offer flexible working arrangements. Our personnel work currently from such diverse locations as Nevada, New York, Richmond, Ireland, and the United Kingdom. 




Work you'll do




You will be primarily working as a member of our outsourced privacy office services. Achieved provides a complete suite of privacy office functions and services on an outsourced basis in this capacity. We operate as if employed by the client. You will be supporting this mission by helping to establish corporate-wide and project-level privacy controls. You will need to identify personal data across a wide range of projects accurately, understand the data inventory and mapping process, ascertain privacy requirements, identify potential privacy risks and mitigations, and prepare policies and procedures under the supervision of Achieved Compliance senior consultants or a client's internal privacy official.   You will need excellent communication, organizational, and project management skills to maintain project dashboards, coordinate meetings, and maintain documentation to demonstrate regulatory compliance.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:




* Helping to evaluate client data privacy maturity by comparing the privacy framework to client policies, procedures, tools, and practices, maintaining maturity scoring.

* Maintaining accurate compliance records, including updating records of processing and data protection impact assessments.

* Conducting inventories of personal information across an organization, sometimes at the department level across different facilities in many jurisdictions.

*Maintaining complex and rapidly changing inventories of data.

*Maintain a global matrix of privacy law(s) and local counsel.  Maintain data protection officer appointments in many jurisdictions.

* Review project contracts, subcontracts, business associate agreements, data use agreements, vendor contracts, master service agreements, and additional contract vehicles for privacy requirements.

* Revise template policies and procedures to reflect client needs and circumstances accurately. Assist with the internal implementation of the same.

* Draft website privacy statements, including website cookie policies.

* Respond to data subject access requests.

* Assist and Work closely with Achieved Compliance senior consultants to design and implement evidence to meet privacy certification controls.

*. Manage status and reporting to provide project clarity to team members and leadership to ensure timely deliverables.

* Manage implementation of privacy tech tools to improve privacy program maturity.

* Assist with responding to project and management ad hoc questions and tasks related to privacy.

* Organize meetings and maintain project dashboard.

* Maintain the data protection officer's documentation of compliance.

*Maintain incident and risk registers.

*Facilitate data discovery and due diligence of 3rd-party service providers.

* Negotiate and maintain data protection agreements.

* Performs other duties as may be assigned by management.




Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience




Bachelor’s degree and 3-8 years of experience in assessment of privacy maturity, gap analysis, project management and implementation of privacy strategies. . Legal or compliance office training is preferred but not required.




Strong interpersonal skills and experience in working cross-functionally with a variety of teams.




Exceptional verbal and written communication, organization, and project management skills, including a strong desire and ability to make complex topics understandable for various audiences.




Self-starter with the ability to learn in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.




Professional experience managing a large program or multiple small simultaneous programs start to finish. Ability to manage priorities in a fast-paced, organizationally complex, deadline-oriented work environment.







Working knowledge of US and global (GDPR, PIPEDA, APP, PIPA, and/or PDPA) privacy laws. Basic understanding of the intersection between privacy laws and sectoral regulations such as protections for health data through regulations such as HIPAA.







Strong organization, attention to detail, analytical skills, and problem-solving capabilities with excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.




Awareness for escalating issues when appropriate.




IAPP certification preferred; required within six months of hire.




Above average level of proficiency in Excel and comfortable working in Teams and other Office applications.

title: Statistical Programmer/Data Analyst RECOVER
industries: Non-profit Organizations, Wellness and Fitness Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) Biostatistics is seeking several Statistical Programmers/Data Analysts to join our team working on the National Institutes of Health (NIH) sponsored RECOVER project, an initiative to understand, prevent, and treat the long-term complications of SARS-CoV-2 infection. Mass General Brigham (MGB) is partnering with the NIH to launch the RECOVER Data Resource Core (DRC), which will contribute to the collection, harmonization, and quality assurance of data collected on study participants, including so-called COVID-19 “long-haulers,” throughout the nation . This team will operate under a Principal Investigator based at MGH.

We are looking for well-organized, dynamic, and highly motivated Statistical Programmers/Data Analysts to join MGH Biostatistics to support conduct of the Data Coordinating Center functions of the RECOVER project. The Statistical Programmer/Data Analyst will report to the Senior Project Biostatistician and will work closely with faculty biostatisticians and study staff to facilitate study operations, data collection and quality control, and reporting of research findings. Strong programming skills in SAS or R, organizational, communication, and problem-solving abilities in a fast-paced research environment are required.

Responsibilities

Create and run the Observational Study Monitoring Board (OSMB) report including tables, figures, listings.
Collaborate with clinical investigators and senior project biostatisticians in preparation of tables and figures for study manuscripts. Help with manuscript review and validation of data abstraction.
Develop code for reports used in study management, including reports for data querying and cleaning, study monitoring and data quality checking.
Develop specifications based on study protocol and write code to calculate derived variables and collaborate with the other statisticians to cross-check and update code as necessary.
Write code to extract data from Electronic Data Capture Systems (EDC) and maintain internal data files for use in reporting and analysis
Provide user support for EDC systems for site coordinators and study investigators, including development of training materials. Work with coordinators and study investigators to resolve data queries in EDC.
Generate custom and/or deidentified datasets for data repositories, ancillary studies, and/or public distribution.
Collaborate with other data managers and statisticians to maintain code base. Create and maintain documentation of datasets and data processes.
Work on optimization and automation of coding, reports, and data processes.

Job Requirements

The Statistical Programmer/Data Analyst must have:

BA or BS degree or equivalent in statistics, computer science, data science or a related field
Minimum six months of experience preparing and analyzing data in a clinical setting.
Strong SAS or R programming skills including re-use of legacy code, creation of de novo code, and implementing validation checks.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively,
Ability to meet project deadlines, maintain up-to-date documentation and a work log,
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Primary Location

MA-Boston-MGH Main Campus

Work Locations

MGH Main Campus

Job

Professional/Managerial

Organization

Massachusetts General Hospital(MGH)

Schedule

Full-time

Standard Hours

40

Shift

Day Job

Posted Shift Description

MGH Biostatistics is seeking several Data Managers to join our team working on the NIH sponsored RECOVER project, an initiative to understand, prevent, and treat the long-term complications of SARS-CoV-2 infection.

Employee Status

Regular

title: Research Assistant (Statistical)/Survey Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
Years of Experience: 0-4 years of experience applying statistical methods to survey or information processing systems including frame maintenance; data research, editing, analysis and interpretation; and in researching energy industry information.

Candidates must be U.S. Citizens and able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust Clearance.

Z FEDERAL is seeking a full-time Research Assistant (Statistical)/Survey Analyst to support our Federal client in Washington, DC. The position entails work on a variety of activities related to the development of annual state-level estimates of energy production, consumption, prices, and expenditures by energy source and consuming sector. The successful candidate will have a strong work ethic and eye for detail; also must be a self-starter, able to work independently on research items as well as in a team to correct problems and ensure data quality. Preference will be given to candidates with previous experience as well as outstanding written, verbal and interpersonal skills.

Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To

Collect, analyze, and prepare data across various energy sources for delivery to the client
Perform analysis of source data against historical data to identify anomalies
Research individual state and energy consuming sector issues to prepare recommendations for estimation methodologies or methodology changes
Conduct basic research to understand trends in price, consumption, and production across all states and sectors
Review and resolve all data issues prior to client review
Assist with maintenance and updates to internal databases and corresponding web pages
Perform a variety of technical tasks to produce energy tables for publication; troubleshoot technical issues independently under short deadlines
Perform in-depth checks and reviews of data and data tables for publication to ensure accuracy and quality.

Minimum Qualifications

0-4 years of experience with applying statistical methods or information processing systems including frame maintenance; data research, editing, analysis and interpretation; and in researching energy industry information.
2+ years of experience with technical software and demonstrated ability to learn new programs independently. Proficient with Microsoft Excel and Access, Adobe InDesign, .NET, VBScript and SQL.
Good oral and written communication skills.
Demonstrate ability to solve quantitative, qualitative, and technical problems both independently and in a team environment.

Z FEDERAL is a professional services firm located in Greenbelt, MD. Founded in 1983 to provide IT and management consulting services to the Federal Government, we have established a proven track record of reliable performance in the Federal marketplace. Z FEDERAL has a history of long-term commitment to our Federal customers and our employees.

Z FEDERAL Offers

Ownership via ESOP
Self-directed 401K
Up to four weeks of paid time off (PTO)
10 paid federal holidays
Other forms of leave such as military leave
Full Health Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision
Life Insurance
Performance-based bonuses
Tuition Reimbursement
Incentive and referral bonuses
Commuter benefits
Professional Development and Training
Years of Service Reward and Recognition Program
Professional Development

Z FEDERAL's commitment to employee growth and development is proven and valued by our staff. We want our employees to excel, grow professionally and take on increasingly responsible roles. Through tuition, certification and continuing education reimbursement, our online knowledge base to expand yours, our employees have a breadth of tools to enhance their skills and grow their careers.

title: Statistical Data Analyst - Biostatistics
comapany: Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis
description:
Performs data management and/or data analysis for investigators using statistical packages. Assists investigators in the design of experiments, clinical trial and epidemiological studies, and related databases. Contributes expertise to building and validating clinical trial databases and developing data management plans for single-center and multicenter studies and to meet institutional needs. Position is within the Division of Biostatistics and is anticipated to support research teams through close collaboration/integration with institutional clinical trial support units including the Center for Clinical Studies (CCS, the School of Medicine’s central clinical trials office) and the Trial-CARE support center which provides specialized expertise to support the design and implementation of investigator-initiated (especially multicenter) clinical trials.




Essential Functions:

1.   Performs data analysis and/or data management for investigators using statistical packages including generation of tables and graphs.

2.   Assists investigators in the design of experiments, clinical trials and epidemiological studies.

3.   Assists in data base design, implementation and maintenance of data collected over time for research purposes, including acquisition, editing, analysis, storage, and reporting.

4.   May assist in design, development, and testing/validation of data entry systems, data management plans, and training resources on clinical trial data stewardship.

5.   May function as a statistical consultant primarily in collaborative studies involving the medical school community.




MINIMUM EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Equivalent of Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (such as, Math, Statistics, Computer Science or Epidemiology). Experience and proficiency with data analysis and data management utilizing statistical packages utilized by department/s.




PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Master’s degree preferred in Statistics, Computer Science or related field. Expert knowledge base and 1-3 years of experience with SAS, data analysis, and data management. Experience in biomedical and/or clinical studies desirable. Familiarity with 21 CFR Part 11 and ICH quality guidelines for clinical trials is a plus.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing and Advertising, and Financial Services
description:
Job Summary:

We are looking for a data privacy engineering analyst to join our Data Governance team. In this role you will work to help implement controls across our data ecosystem and drive customer centric privacy solutions across our products. You will directly contribute to the success of our data strategy by working cross-functionally with data, legal, engineering and product.

At DSS, data is central to measuring all aspects of the business, and critical to its operations and growth. Data Governance works closely with data engineering, legal, back-end services and front-end technology teams to drive our governance strategy designed to ensure quality data that is both secure and compliant with internal and external compliance legal guidelines such as CCPA and GDPR.

Responsibilities:


Build and maintain high quality processes for ongoing regulatory and compliance controls while managing compliance audits and processes
Lead and improve our control assurance program via automated controls, audits, certifications and regulatory compliance programs
Partner with engineering, legal and data to understand and align compliance requirements for software and analytics solutions deployed
Build and deploy solutions for GDPR and CCPA regulatory compliance
Guide technical and operational requirements from a data compliance perspective to inform future offerings in accordance with regulatory requirements
Communicate risk assessment and/or audit findings to management, develop improvements in the design and effectiveness of key controls including automation
Contribute to global, regional and local business risk initiatives aimed at improving our baseline on information protection, resiliency and controls of technology processes and services
Contribute to the overall business risk profile working with stakeholders to reduce risk and exposure in an agile, collaborative, and well socialized manner
Develop, maintain, and improve data platform reflecting new and emerging risks


Basic Qualifications:


2+ years’ experience with data privacy/compliance, IT security, technical risk or related audits
2+ years of Python and SQL
1+ years of Cloud experience (AWS preferred) related to risk and information security or related fields
Experience working with regulatory compliance frameworks such as GDPR and CCPA
Understanding of native applications and micro service architecture
Exceptional interpersonal skills and written communication skills
Ability to evaluate risks and provide recommendations / solutions in a timely manner


Preferred Qualifications:


Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and security concepts, including managing compliance requirements against distributed applications on cloud infrastructure (e.g. Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure).
Familiarity with security controls for cloud automation and configuration tooling (e.g. GuardDuty, Jenkins, etc.) and data platforms and applications such as Databricks, Jupyter, Snowflake, Redshift, Airflow
Experience in the technology, streaming or security industry


Required Education


Bachelor's degree required in information science, data management, computer science or related field preferred

title: Geospatial Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
The opportunity

FACTOR, INC., a leading provider of risk management solutions for government and industry, is seeking a Geospatial Data Analyst to work remotely with our growing team.


You have a passion for engaging with new GIS technologies, providing support to technical staff, and conducting independent research and analysis to support public safety and security.


We will rely on you to deliver high-value solutions and data analyses, including written and oral presentations of findings, internally and to our clients, while working on multiple projects with a seasoned team of consultants, scientists, and engineers in a remote, Agile environment.


You will thrive in this environment if you are a passionate, self-driven, and detail-oriented team player with strong decision-making, problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.


Your impact

• Contribute to our creative analyses and proven software solutions for a variety of corporate and government clients in the transportation, energy, chemical, insurance, and public sectors

• Collaborate with team members and partners to support geospatial analysis requirements

• Conduct independent research and analysis and communicate findings

• Leverage GIS tools to conduct geospatial analyses and support the development, testing, and maintenance of GIS-enabled software

• Create, manipulate, and maintain geospatial network, environmental, and demographic datasets

• Prepare maps and information products to effectively communicate important concepts


Required education and experience

• 1+ years of relevant experience or a master’s degree

• Bachelor’s degree in Geographic Information Systems, Data Science, Environmental Science, Engineering, or other technical discipline; master’s degree or graduate certificate preferred

• GISP certification, or ability to obtain certification, is preferred

• Must show proof of eligibility to legally work within the United States

•
Ability to obtain a DoD Secret Security Clearance and pass other industry-specific background screening; please review the requirements at https://www.clearancejobs.com/security-clearance-faqs#getting-a-security-clearance-3 before applying


Highly desired skills and experience

• Expertise with Geographic Information Systems, including any of the following:
• Esri products

• Alternative and opensource GIS (e.g., QGIS)

• Web mapping tools (e.g., ArcGIS Online, GeoServer)

• Geospatial statistics, transportation networks, or raster analysis

• Cartography and data visualization


• Familiarity with concepts of risk assessment or analysis

• Experience with tabular data analysis using tools such as spreadsheets, pivot tables, and SQL queries

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills to support internal and external communications

• Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word, Outlook, Access, and PowerPoint

• Experience with any of the following is preferred:
• Analysis of freight transportation, safety, or environmental data

• Data science, statistics, or modeling

• SQL, Python, or programming languages

• Software development


• Ability to collaborate with a team from a self-driven, remote environment

• Our federal contracts require compliance with Executive Order 14042 mandating COVID-19 vaccination; accommodations will be considered in accordance with federal, state, and local laws


What we offer

• Competitive salary

• Company bonus program participation

• 401K plan with company match

• Company subsidized medical and dental insurance

• Company provided Disability and Life Insurance

• Paid Holidays, Vacation, and Sick Leave

• Tuition Reimbursement

• Flexible and Remote Work Arrangements

• Career and promotion opportunities


Why join us?

Professional Growth: We support your growth at FACTOR and as a professional through training, mentorship, and supporting your certification in sought-after skills.


A Passionate Team: We believe in collaboration among passionate, diverse, and motivated team members, clients, and stakeholders to understand various viewpoints and solve challenging issues.


Rewarding Work: Besides offering a competitive salary and benefits, we offer the chance to make a real-world difference by supporting the safety and security risk mitigation work of our clients.


Flexible, Remote Work: Our geographically diverse workforce spans 4 time zones and 7 states. We have a decade of experience serving our clients remotely and offer flexible hours when needed.


FACTOR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal opportunity employment without regard to race, religion, color, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, ancestry, national origin, military or veteran status, marital status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Entry Level - Masters Degree Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Motor Vehicle Manufacturing
description:
About GM

Job Description

There's never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including openwork spacesand virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteerinterests,andmake it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

General Motorshasan exciting opportunity forrecentcollege graduateswho are technical, innovative, problem solverstoapply toour Analytics Career Evolution (ACE)development program.

Employees hired intothe ACE program willhave an opportunity toacceleratetheirprofessionalexperienceand expand their networkbyworkingacross severalareas of GMfor the fewyearsoftheiremployment.The ACE development program will provide a vast number ofexciting projects, visibility to senior leadership, robusttraining,and networking opportunities.

At the end of thedevelopmentprogram,ACEemployees willhave an opportunity to work withACEprogram leaders and human resources to find their next role within general motors.In anticipation of these opportunities becoming available, if you are interested in learning more about GM, completing this profile will allow us to stay connected.

If you share our passion for reimagining transportation and creating a safer,betterand more sustainable future, we encourage you to learn more about our available positions and apply today!

Weare Looking For DataAnalystprofessionals Who

Have a steadfast drive for excellence
Challenge themselves and their peers
Enjoy working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Demonstrate a good work ethic
Have a strong ability and willingness to learn
Exhibit curiosity and are willing to explore new possibilities and solutions
Understand advanced math and analytics concepts, andcanapply them to real applications
Desire to deliver innovative solutions to complex problems

Role -as a Data Analyst, they support operational improvement and business decision making through ad-hoc statistical analysis of curated enterprise data and self-constructed data sets. Data Analysts collaborate closely with business leaders, IT partners, and other analysts to develop new and unique data-driven solutions using Big Data platforms, creative analytical methods, and data visualization techniques.

Requirements

Additional Job Description

Education:Master'sdegree - Mathematics, Computer Science,Statistics,Economics, Social Science,or other quantitative degree preferred
Preferred academic or work experience in a data-intensive field/industry such as biotechnology, computational chemistry, cognitive or neurosciences, behavioral economics, econometrics, engineering, physics, quantitative finance, high frequency trading or intelligence analytics
Job locations will be in Warren or Detroit, Michigan; some roles will consider remote work

Technical Experience (or Exposure To)

Big data tools such as Hadoop, Greenplum, Spark, Hue, and Knime
Business intelligence and data visualization tools including PowerBI, Excel, and Cognos.
Proficiency in one of the following programming languages is desired: Python, R, Postgres, and HQL/SQL
Knowledgeable of statistical methods such as regression, probability analysis, risk analysis, statistical process control, and clustering is desired

This Role Offers The FollowingWork Appropriatelystrategies

Remote: The selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.
Hybrid:This position does not require an employee to be onsite full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.

Relocation assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements.

PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU DO NOT NEED SPONSORSHIP TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. WE ARE UNABLE TO CONSIDER CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE SPONSORSHIP.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:

Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. title: Quantitative QA Analyst
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Engineering
industries: Financial Services
description:
Job Description

Job Purpose

Intercontinental Exchange is looking for a Quantitative QA Analyst to be a part of our team. This role resides within the Clearing Technology segment of ICE. Clearing technology provides automation of risk management and modeling to ensure that markets can operate rapidly and efficiently while minimizing the likelihood of adverse outcomes during market volatility. The Quantitative QA role brings expertise in financial mathematics and technology to the clearing technology group.

You must be results-oriented, self-motivated and have the ability to thrive in a fast-pace environment. This role requires frequent interaction with project managers, developers, product managers, and risk management/quantitative analysts in order to ensure that we deliver a quality clearing house risk platform to our users. Analytical skills and the ability to understand and test quantitative risk assessment/margin calculation models are crucial for the role.

Responsibilities

Develop reference implementations for testing platform applications, based on technical business requirements
Review technical requirements with quantitative models terminology to produce test strategies, test scenarios, and test cases
Implement, maintain, and troubleshoot test harnesses, including implementations for various quantitative models
Define test scenarios and develop/maintain automated test cases
Create test plans, defining test scope, resources, dependencies, risks, and the overall strategy for testing complex software systems
Perform all aspects of verification, including functional, regression, system, and integration testing for applications designed using multi-tiered-based architecture
Deploy application builds and maintain test environments
Perform troubleshooting of software / hardware configuration problems
Demonstrate a passion for finding software bugs in complex algorithms

Knowledge And Experience

M.S. or higher in a Financial Engineering, Mathematics, or Computer Science related discipline
Experience with modeling/statistical analysis tools such as Python, R, or MATLAB
Ability to implement quantitative algorithms and develop automated tests using a scripting/programming language
Ability to write and execute customized SQL queries against Oracle DB
Ability to calculate customized statistics on large sets of data
Ability to understand use Python code and spreadsheets containing financial engineering formulas
Must have understanding of derivatives markets and options/asset pricing models
Must be comfortable with working across systems in a high tech software development environment
Progress toward CFA, FRM, or similar credentials a plus
2+ years’ experience with commodity markets, financial trading environment, or equity brokerage business and exposure to futures markets is a plus
Value at Risk (VaR), parametric, Historical Simulation, or other portfolio risk management understanding a plus
Must have excellent communication skills

title: Data Privacy Analyst
description:
Privacy and Compliance Analyst About ProfitPay

ProfitPay is the first globally connected Fintech marketplace, unifying banking and business without borders. The sum of our people’s talent and experience is what makes ProfitPay a unique, innovative, and reliable company. We find joy in putting our users first and creating user centric experiences by offering products that help simplify their lives. Our goal is to redefine traditional finance to create a more profitable future by offering virtual cards, payments processing, and growth capital to our customers.

About the job

Are you ready to be a part of a first-class team changing the FinTech industry? We are looking for a Privacy and Compliance Analyst that is passionate about protecting customer data and the integrity of the data privacy compliance program. Reporting directly to the Chief Compliance Officer, you will provide support and management for ProfitPay’s global privacy compliance program. The focus of this role is to provide compliance support, perform assessments, and monitor and report on the on-going data protection requirements within ProfitPay. The ideal candidate should have an in-depth understanding of data privacy concepts along with good technical knowledge and experience in carrying out detailed data privacy consulting and risk assessment activities

Responsibilities

Review and update ProfitPay’s data privacy policies and procedures.
Partner closely with engineering and business teams to develop data security, data access, and privacy programs.
Establish processes to ensure compliance with domestic and international privacy regulations and assist in the monitoring and testing of such programs.
Contribute to, and maintain, the company’s privacy system and develop best practices for ProfitPay to adhere to.
Regularly monitor and report on changes in data protection obligations that may impact the organization.
Coordinates fact gathering, response, root cause analysis, and mitigation efforts for privacy related incidents.
Create and maintain appropriate privacy and confidentiality consents, authorization forms and information notices and materials reflecting current organizational and legal requirements and practices
Build and deploy solutions for GDPR and CCPA regulatory compliance
Develops reporting on overall status of the data privacy program to leadership.
Manages and maintains Data Privacy program documentation.
Work with product and engineering to ensure all best practices are being followed.
Serve as an information privacy resource to the organization regarding release of information and to all departments when privacy issues arise

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree
Experience in data privacy REQUIRED; 5+ years of experience in data privacy compliance preferred
Develop privacy notices and necessary guidance on privacy controls
Assist and advise business teams on designing and implementing effective data protection controls
Carry out data privacy impact assessments for personal data processing activities
Previous startup and/or FinTech experience a plus
GDPR experience a strong plus but not required
Certified Privacy-related experience with certification, such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP/US) or Certified Information Privacy Technologist (CIPT) strongly preferred

title: Research Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
Description

Job Description:

The Leidos Military & Veterans Solutions Health Group is currently seeking a full-time Research Data Analyst to support the Warfighter Performance Department at the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego, CA. This position will support the Sleep, Tactical Efficiency, and Endurance Laboratory (STEEL) with the development of research protocol design, coding for research studies aimed at improving warfighter performance. The successful candidate will work closely and collaboratively with Principal Investigators, project managers, research assistants, and subject matter experts to identify ways to answer complex mental and physical health questions with data collected from human subjects research protocols. The ideal candidate will be motivated, detail-oriented, able to take initiative, and work well both independently and as part of a team. The ideal candidate will also be proficient in using R primarily (but Python and Julia would also be valuable), and should have a deep interest in cultivating best practices in programming (e.g., writing efficient, function-driven code; experience using the Tidyverse, and some understanding of the principles behind its philosophy) and maintaining complicated project structures. An aesthetic appreciation for what good code looks like is also a big plus. A successful candidate must be able to model the Leidos Mission, Vision, and Values at all times.

Primary Responsibilities

Specifically, the candidate will be required to:

Work with Principal Investigators, scientists, and other members of the research team to refine research methodology, construct databases, provide coding and programming expertise for research studies, apply statistical methods, and interpret results to appropriately answer study questions.
Access various secondary data sources to extract relevant data and construct comprehensive, project-specific datasets.
Lead data management processes, including data verification, cleaning, quality assurance, and merging.
Perform data manipulations and transformation on raw data using R to create analytics-friendly datasets for research projects (e.g., tidy datasets). Additional experience with Python or Julia would also be desirable.
Maintain and update documentation on all processes and procedures, including data dictionaries and codebooks.
Conduct statistical analyses using R (primarily, but Python and Julia would also be desirable). Familiarity with a broad range of statistical techniques, to include traditional (e.g., logistic regression, standard least squares regression, analysis of variance, etc.) and machine learning techniques (e.g., random forest, CART, etc.). Experience with more specific kinds of techniques, such as survival analysis, equivalence testing, structural equation modeling, Monte Carlo simulation, Bayesian analysis, among others, would be highly desirable.
Develop statistical plans for research proposals and research protocols, determining appropriate subject numbers required for successful study completion.
Contribute to the preparation of study deliverables, presentations, reports, and publications.

Basic Qualifications

Master’s Degree in Biostatistics, Public Health, Physiology, Psychology, Neuroscience, or related field
2 or more years of experience with coding and programming for research studies
2 or more years of experience in conducting statistical analyses for human subjects research projects.
Experience in literate programming practices (e.g., using R Markdown to produce reproducible reports with embedded code; automating this process).
Must be a U.S. Citizen and able to obtain a Secret Clearance
Able to travel locally, nationally, and internationally as needed for meetings and conferences

Preferred Qualifications

3 or more years’ experience in programming, coding, and conducting statistical analyses for human subjects research projects
Demonstrated experience programming with Python or Julia for research projects.
Experience in research with military populations
Active secret clearance

Naval Health West - NHW

title: STATISTICAL PROGRAMMER ANALYST
industries: Research Services, Wellness and Fitness Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
At Moffitt Cancer Center, we come face-to-face with cancer every day, but we also see courage. And it inspires us to be the safest and best place for cancer care – to bring greater hope to every patient we serve. It’s why we’ve been continually named One of the Top Places to Work in the Tampa Bay Area. As the only National Cancer Institute-designated Comprehensive Cancer Center based in Florida, Moffitt employs some of the best and brightest minds from around the world. Moffitt is the leading cancer hospital in both Florida and the Southeast and has been nationally ranked by U.S. News & World Report since 1999. Because working at Moffitt is both a career and a mission: to contribute to the prevention and cure of cancer. Join a dedicated, diverse and inclusive team of over 7,000 to be a part of the Courageous future we envision.

Summary

The Statistical Programmer Analyst performs data cleaning, manipulation, and management, and basic level statistical analysis and programming for clinical trials and/or research projects with guidance from more senior biostatisticians (faculty or non-faculty). Experienced in programming using SAS and R for data management and analyses. Proven written and oral communication skills are essential.

An Overview Of The Role

With appropriate guidance, prepares data management plans. Independently cleans and manages data, and analysis of basic data requests.
Creates cleaned datasets using SAS and R; combines multiple disparate raw databases and derives analysis variables accurately. Uses basic SAS and R procedures and options and programs with increasing efficiency. Writes own SAS and R code, finds errors, corrects, and validates data quality and results.
Collaborates and communicates effectively with a variety of types of individuals: programmers, biostatisticians (both junior and senior), and medical personnel.
Demonstrates understanding of basic data collection processes and data sets and shares knowledge with collaborators, fellow biostatisticians, and other team members.

The Ideal Candidate Will Demonstrate

1 year of statistical programming experience in the process of data management.
Experience programming in SAS and R.
A Bachelor’s Degree in Biostatistics, bioinformatics, data science, or other data-analysis related field.

Preferred

2 years of statistical programming experience in the process of data management. Experience with cancer or other health-related data.
A Master’s Degree in Biostatistics, bioinformatics, data science, or other data-analysis related field.

title: Data Privacy Analyst/Project Coordinator
description:
Position: Data Privacy Analyst/Project Coordinator

Benefits: Salary, Health insurance and 401K

Location: Northern Virginia, Hybrid or Remote







Achieved Compliance Solutions is a growing and dynamic service provider of data privacy solutions and services. We provide long-term, outsourced data privacy office functions to corporate entities and research institutions with complex, global data privacy issues. Our clients are active in 60+ jurisdictions, and so is Achieved!  Clients have appointed us as their official data protection officer in dozens of jurisdictions, including the Republic of Ireland, the UK, France, South Africa, Brazil, and Nigeria. Achieved's mission is to ensure each client exceeds the requirements of best practices, regulations, and ethics in each of the jurisdictions in which they engage. 




When joining the Achieved Compliance team, you will gain a world-view of data privacy and significant experience working intimately with the practical operations of organizations. You will grow through substantial opportunities to work with several clients on a virtual secondment-basis in operational, temporary assignments – all while receiving world-class training as an Achieved Compliance consultant. This position is a truly unique opportunity.




Achieved has a growing practice focused on the life sciences and, in particular, entities conducting global research, clinical trials, or support for the same, including health-tech and international logistics and distribution of products. The successful candidate is likely to gain experience implementing a complete privacy program across 3000+ international health research programs, working daily with a committed and world-class internal team. A demonstrated interest in the life sciences and health sectors is preferred but not necessary.




We are looking for curious, communicative, and energetic individuals committed to developing themselves and learning new skills. Based in Northern Virginia's technology hub, we offer flexible working arrangements. Our personnel work currently from such diverse locations as Nevada, New York, Richmond, Ireland, and the United Kingdom. 




Work you'll do




You will be primarily working as a member of our outsourced privacy office services. Achieved provides a complete suite of privacy office functions and services on an outsourced basis in this capacity. We operate as if employed by the client. You will be supporting this mission by helping to establish corporate-wide and project-level privacy controls. You will need to identify personal data across a wide range of projects accurately, understand the data inventory and mapping process, ascertain privacy requirements, identify potential privacy risks and mitigations, and prepare policies and procedures under the supervision of Achieved Compliance senior consultants or a client's internal privacy official.   You will need excellent communication, organizational, and project management skills to maintain project dashboards, coordinate meetings, and maintain documentation to demonstrate regulatory compliance.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:




* Helping to evaluate client data privacy maturity by comparing the privacy framework to client policies, procedures, tools, and practices, maintaining maturity scoring.

* Maintaining accurate compliance records, including updating records of processing and data protection impact assessments.

* Conducting inventories of personal information across an organization, sometimes at the department level across different facilities in many jurisdictions.

*Maintaining complex and rapidly changing inventories of data.

*Maintain a global matrix of privacy law(s) and local counsel.  Maintain data protection officer appointments in many jurisdictions.

* Review project contracts, subcontracts, business associate agreements, data use agreements, vendor contracts, master service agreements, and additional contract vehicles for privacy requirements.

* Revise template policies and procedures to reflect client needs and circumstances accurately. Assist with the internal implementation of the same.

* Draft website privacy statements, including website cookie policies.

* Respond to data subject access requests.

* Assist and Work closely with Achieved Compliance senior consultants to design and implement evidence to meet privacy certification controls.

*. Manage status and reporting to provide project clarity to team members and leadership to ensure timely deliverables.

* Manage implementation of privacy tech tools to improve privacy program maturity.

* Assist with responding to project and management ad hoc questions and tasks related to privacy.

* Organize meetings and maintain project dashboard.

* Maintain the data protection officer's documentation of compliance.

*Maintain incident and risk registers.

*Facilitate data discovery and due diligence of 3rd-party service providers.

* Negotiate and maintain data protection agreements.

* Performs other duties as may be assigned by management.




Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience




Bachelor’s degree and 3-8 years of experience in assessment of privacy maturity, gap analysis, project management and implementation of privacy strategies. . Legal or compliance office training is preferred but not required.




Strong interpersonal skills and experience in working cross-functionally with a variety of teams.




Exceptional verbal and written communication, organization, and project management skills, including a strong desire and ability to make complex topics understandable for various audiences.




Self-starter with the ability to learn in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.




Professional experience managing a large program or multiple small simultaneous programs start to finish. Ability to manage priorities in a fast-paced, organizationally complex, deadline-oriented work environment.







Working knowledge of US and global (GDPR, PIPEDA, APP, PIPA, and/or PDPA) privacy laws. Basic understanding of the intersection between privacy laws and sectoral regulations such as protections for health data through regulations such as HIPAA.







Strong organization, attention to detail, analytical skills, and problem-solving capabilities with excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.




Awareness for escalating issues when appropriate.




IAPP certification preferred; required within six months of hire.




Above average level of proficiency in Excel and comfortable working in Teams and other Office applications.

title: Statistical Programmer/Data Analyst RECOVER
industries: Non-profit Organizations, Wellness and Fitness Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) Biostatistics is seeking several Statistical Programmers/Data Analysts to join our team working on the National Institutes of Health (NIH) sponsored RECOVER project, an initiative to understand, prevent, and treat the long-term complications of SARS-CoV-2 infection. Mass General Brigham (MGB) is partnering with the NIH to launch the RECOVER Data Resource Core (DRC), which will contribute to the collection, harmonization, and quality assurance of data collected on study participants, including so-called COVID-19 “long-haulers,” throughout the nation . This team will operate under a Principal Investigator based at MGH.

We are looking for well-organized, dynamic, and highly motivated Statistical Programmers/Data Analysts to join MGH Biostatistics to support conduct of the Data Coordinating Center functions of the RECOVER project. The Statistical Programmer/Data Analyst will report to the Senior Project Biostatistician and will work closely with faculty biostatisticians and study staff to facilitate study operations, data collection and quality control, and reporting of research findings. Strong programming skills in SAS or R, organizational, communication, and problem-solving abilities in a fast-paced research environment are required.

Responsibilities

Create and run the Observational Study Monitoring Board (OSMB) report including tables, figures, listings.
Collaborate with clinical investigators and senior project biostatisticians in preparation of tables and figures for study manuscripts. Help with manuscript review and validation of data abstraction.
Develop code for reports used in study management, including reports for data querying and cleaning, study monitoring and data quality checking.
Develop specifications based on study protocol and write code to calculate derived variables and collaborate with the other statisticians to cross-check and update code as necessary.
Write code to extract data from Electronic Data Capture Systems (EDC) and maintain internal data files for use in reporting and analysis
Provide user support for EDC systems for site coordinators and study investigators, including development of training materials. Work with coordinators and study investigators to resolve data queries in EDC.
Generate custom and/or deidentified datasets for data repositories, ancillary studies, and/or public distribution.
Collaborate with other data managers and statisticians to maintain code base. Create and maintain documentation of datasets and data processes.
Work on optimization and automation of coding, reports, and data processes.

Job Requirements

The Statistical Programmer/Data Analyst must have:

BA or BS degree or equivalent in statistics, computer science, data science or a related field
Minimum six months of experience preparing and analyzing data in a clinical setting.
Strong SAS or R programming skills including re-use of legacy code, creation of de novo code, and implementing validation checks.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively,
Ability to meet project deadlines, maintain up-to-date documentation and a work log,
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Primary Location

MA-Boston-MGH Main Campus

Work Locations

MGH Main Campus

Job

Professional/Managerial

Organization

Massachusetts General Hospital(MGH)

Schedule

Full-time

Standard Hours

40

Shift

Day Job

Posted Shift Description

MGH Biostatistics is seeking several Data Managers to join our team working on the NIH sponsored RECOVER project, an initiative to understand, prevent, and treat the long-term complications of SARS-CoV-2 infection.

Employee Status

Regular

Recruiting Department

MGH Biostatistics Center
