title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
Job Title: Data Quality Analyst

Location: Richardson,TX

Duration: Long term contract

 

Job Description: 

Experience - Data Governance and Data Stewardship
Self Starter with little training
Excellent Communication both written and verbal
Thinks quick on feet and out of the Box
In this role, the Data Quality Analyst on the data governance team will assist the business in making better decisions through collection and usage of data and ensuring our data is cared for through its complete lifecycle, as an enterprise asset.
Data Quality Analyst partners across various functional teams to ensure data is created, managed and effectively utilized as trusted enterprise assets. This role will also serve as the primary contact representative responsible for documenting definitions of data, ensuring the correct usage and context of data, enforcing policy/security/privacy requirements and maintaining data quality and integrity within a respective business data domain.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Understand the business processes to provide insights into critical data elements, their governance and management and drive consistent usage Involved in the creation or enhancement efforts of metadata repositories, data dictionaries, data quality rules, data lineage, reference data, functional process mapping efforts and related data governance procedures.
Work with business stakeholders to validate, create and run data quality rules for all governed data elements within their functional areas.
Help identify metadata-related inconsistencies across business areas and partner with business, product and engineering teams to build solutions.
Determine and monitor data quality metrics from data sources to measure applicable dimensions of completeness, accuracy and consistency of data.
Drive exploratory data analysis and provide results to Business Partners to drive value generating activities for managing risks and enhancing controls.
Conduct root-cause analysis for data defects, and support and promote its resolution.
Identify sensitive data and assist in classification and setting up a security framework for respective data domains.
Partner with Compliance and Data Privacy teams to analyze any impact from regulatory landscape changes across multiple regions

 

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in computer science, math, engineering or related field. Masters degree preferred.
3+ years of combined experience in data governance.
Experience includes working on data and data quality initiatives, aligning business processes with data, implementing technology solutions, developing or supporting standards / policies and data-related issue management and remediation efforts.
Experience with data management processes and tools and applications, including process mapping, profiling, creation of rules and building lineage (e.g. Collibra, Informatica Data Quality, Ataccama)
Experience interacting with various database and file storage systems (DB2, IDMS, Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL), data manipulation language (i.e. SQL), and/or data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI).
Advanced Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills including pivot tables, advanced charting, advanced formulas, conditional formatting
Excellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills with proven ability to establish and cultivate relationships with key partners
Motivated to understand and keep current with relevant Industry trends and best practices Strong critical thinking skills and ability to navigate.

description:
We’re working on making the global financial system programmable. This is one of the largest opportunities for impact in the history of computing, on par with the rise of modern operating systems. Enabling the realization of this opportunity and simultaneously controlling our credit risk exposure, the Credit Risk team plays a critical role in the company’s financial health.

We’re looking for an experienced data analyst to partner with the Credit Risk team as well as our Merchant Intelligence team to drive the use of data to measure and limit our credit risk, ensure high-quality decisions, and point towards future opportunities. The ideal candidate has experience in credit risk data analysis, thinks creatively about measurement that leads to actionable outcomes, and values rigor in experimentation.

You Will

Work closely with the Credit Risk team to solve their most pressing challenges using data and insights
Focus on understanding the underlying needs of the Credit Risk team and working with them to design dashboards and metrics to address those needs
Use data to support the development of risk mitigation strategies and interventions while preserving and improving the user experience
Evolve our risk metrics, the datasets to support them, and the measurement of causal impact of initiatives to improve them

You’d Ideally Have

3+ years experience in data analytics preferably related to credit risk
Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering)
Experience and passion for metrics and dashboard visualizations
Highly skilled at writing SQL to query relational databases; knowledge of R or Python and prior experience with writing and debugging data pipelines using a distributed data framework (Hadoop/Spark/Pig/etc.) a plus
Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills

title: Bioinformatics Data Analyst
industries: Computer Software, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry, by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

You will be on the front-lines developing responses to a variety of inquiries from our healthcare providers, collaborators, and patients. This position is responsible for compiling and analyzing data to respond to client inquiries.

What You’ll Do

Perform risk-based assessments of occurrences and urgent inquiries, drawing on molecular genetics and clinical testing experience to prioritize investigations while balancing customer needs against the team’s available resources
Aggregate and present data for root cause analysis and CAPAs as appropriate
Work closely with Lab Directors in collaboration with the Client Services, ClinConsult, and Medical teams to investigate and analyze issues and strive for utmost client satisfaction with the entire Invitae experience
Explore data to assess continuous process improvements following resolution of escalated inquiries in order to enhance internal processes and client satisfaction
Provide clear, concise written and oral communication including of technical findings to non-technical teammates
When laboratory issues are identified as a result of client inquiries, initiate incident reports and ensure appropriate documentation.

What You’ll Bring

Expert in Python data management and problem solving
Strong knowledge of querying databases: SQL, datalog, etc.
Knowledge of human molecular genetics and experience in a clinical testing laboratory
Understanding of NGS results, data analysis, and variant interpretation
Ability to understand customers’ questions and translate to an actionable analysis plan
Excellent trouble-shooting skills: Ability to successfully analyze problems and propose solutions to the medical escalation investigation leadership.
Experience working within a knowledge management and documentation management environment
Preference for industry experience in healthcare, biotech, and/or life sciences. Bonus: Familiarity and/or hands-on experience with DNA/RNA extraction and next-generation sequencing (NGS) wet lab protocols, preferably in a production setting.
Preferred PhD, MS or equivalent experience

title: Actuarial Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.

At AXIS, we believe that we are only as strong as our people. We strive to create an inclusive and welcoming culture where employees of all backgrounds and from all walks of life feel comfortable and empowered to be themselves. This means that we bring our whole selves to work.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for candidates taking part in the selection process.

Role Description

This role will be responsible for working with the actuarial and technology teams to of AXIS Insurance Pricing Actuarial and Analytic data and analytic tool needs. The role is responsible for gathering requirements for data and designing, prototyping and implementing ad hoc solutions required to support the analytical needs of the actuaries for acquisition of data and analytical tools. The role may work with the IT department to set requirements and perform testing for more robust data acquisition, or software installation or configuration projects.

Responsibilities

Prototype, develop, maintain various data acquisition and retrieval flows. Requiring having an in-depth understanding of data systems, and how they relate to actuarial use.
Work with actuaries and source data experts to ensure data is accurate and fit for purpose; develop and implement control processes as necessary to monitor data accuracy and quality.
Work hands on as necessary to develop prototypes of solutions to validate the requirements and designs. Provide requirements to segment IT and assist with UAT as needed to implement solutions in production environments.
Work closely with Pricing and Risk actuaries to ensure that data and analytical solutions meet needs across the Insurance. Work with business intelligence resources to ensure that these solutions will also meet requirements for management information / business intelligence needs. Solutions need to balance both ad-hoc needs as well as longer term strategic development.
Utilize advanced excel functions, VBA, etc. to build solutions to data related issues. Including pulling and inserting data from SQL Server, building reports, etc.
Work with IT to ensure that data elements, logic, etc. aligns with the needs and expectations of the actuarial group.
Communicate openly and often with Insurance Pricing, Reserving and risk teams, and customers of the analytic environment regarding priorities and progress

Required Skills And Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Prior experience delivering data for actuarial analytics and business intelligence solutions
Experience in / with:
SQL/T-SQL - SQL Server Management Studio, Access
VBA
Excel
Word
PowerPoint
SSIS, not required but experience is a plus
SharePoint, not required but experience is a plus
Experience with insurance and/or actuarial concepts/terminology

title: Data Quality Analyst
comapany: The Center for Health Information and Analysis
industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
The mission of the Center for Health Information and Analysis (CHIA) is to be the agency of record for Massachusetts health care information, to responsibly steward sensitive and confidential data, and to objectively report reliable and meaningful information about the quality, affordability, utilization, access, and outcomes of the Massachusetts health care system

CHIA’s Data Operations Technology unit is seeking an experienced Data Quality Analyst (“Analyst”) to be responsible for a variety of quality assurance activities in the Center’s database environment. The key role of the Analyst will be to assure that any data releases meet CHIA’s data quality standards. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to, profiling and analyzing very large, complex databases to enhance data quality, confirming database source-to-target mapping, and developing compliance assurance metrics. The Analyst will work on a team with other Analysts and collaborate with other Data Operations Technology groups and internal Business Partners.

This is a full-time position, normally based in the Center’s office near Copley Square in Boston. Currently, the Center’s staff is operating remotely. The successful candidate must be prepared to work at the Boston office as needed while leading up to the office opening and available to work in the Boston office later in 2021.

Specifically the analyst will:

Provide data profiling expertise to all MA APCD and Case Mix projects, including but not limited to, new data intake and derived data elements.
Use profiling results to define specifications for automated quality assurance processes and ongoing monitoring of data.
Identify, compare and resolve data quality problems.
Determine root cause for data quality errors and make recommendations for long-term solutions.
Work with programmers to correct data quality errors.
Develop process improvements to enhance overall data quality.
Develop and execute data cleanup measures.
Identify areas of improvement to enhance data quality.
Implement test scripts, record actual results, and identify defects.
Automated test script preparation and execution.
Develop and maintain quality assurance procedure documentation.
Construct well-formed queries and procedures which take advantage of performance optimization.
Suggest new process optimizations based on business needs.
Ensure accuracy of ETL processes, including but not limited to the validation of business rules and transformation procedures
Stay relevant and up-to-date on new data profiling technology and business intelligence tools
Remain committed at all times to data quality, integrity and security


Preferred Qualifications:

Strong Analytic, data quality and data manipulation skills;
Demonstrated proficiency in statistical analysis applications including SQL, SAS and/or STAT;
Proficiency in Tableau;
Demonstrated proficiency in applied statistical sampling;
Knowledge of health care data, claims and data reporting systems;
Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions;
Working knowledge of relational databases;
Demonstrated proficiency in desktop software such as; Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint;
Ability to work effectively with employees with diverse skillsets;
Ability to identify and resolve problems with datasets and analysis;
Ability to effectively communicate analytic results and measurements;
Strong interpersonal collaboration and communication skills;
Developed problem solving skills;
Demonstrable written and user documentation skills;
Current knowledge of industry testing and data quality measurement techniques and methods.


Minimum Entrance Requirements:

Analyst must have at least five years of full-time, professional experience where the major duties include statistical programming, data quality analysis or data compliance activities. At least one year must be in the health care industry working in research and analysis, reporting, and/or data quality.

A Bachelor’s degree or higher in information technologies (IT), mathematics, computer science, public health or health services administration, may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required experience.

Compensation:

This position will remain open until filled. The anticipated full time salary range for this position is $80,000-$90,000 commensurate with experience.

Total Compensation:

As an employee of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts you are offered a great career opportunity influencing a wide-spectrum of services to the diverse populations we serve - but it's more than a paycheck. The State's total compensation package features an outstanding set of employee benefits which you should consider towards your overall compensation, including:

75% state paid medical insurance premium
Reasonable Dental and Vision Plans
Flexible Spending Account and Dependent Care Assistance programs
Low cost basic and optional life insurance
Retirement Savings: State Employees' Pension and a Deferred Compensation 457(b) plan
11 paid holidays per year and competitive Sick, Vacation and Personal Time
Tuition Benefit for employee and spouse at state colleges and universities
Extended Illness program participation
Professional Development and Continuing Education opportunities
Qualified Employer for Public Service Student Loan Forgiveness Program

title: Legal Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Financial Services
description:
Thinking about an alternative legal career? Bloomberg Law offers an opportunity to advance and develop your legal career through a distinctive, non-traditional path. This role allows you to blend your passion for the law with technology, business, and data analysis. Bloomberg Law is dependent upon our legal data analysts to use their legal domain knowledge, critical thinking and strategic approach to build excellent products.

As a member of the Legal Data Analysis team, you will align closely with both our business and engineering teams to help drive product development and ensure data accuracy in Bloomberg Law"s initiatives. We apply our robust legal domain knowledge, project management skills and sharp attention to detail to annotate, analyze and evaluate legal datasets including court opinions, court briefs and contractual provisions. The team's work is critical in supporting feature developments that use artificial intelligence and machine learning including Points of Law, Brief Analyzer and Draft Analyzer. This role will give the opportunity to display your enthusiasm, problem-solving and organizational skills, ability to collaborate, and flexibility in pivoting between projects in a fast-paced environment. This position can be located in either New York or Princeton NJ.

What's in it for you:

Contribute to the Bloomberg Law platform by supporting the development of new technology-driven solutions for the legal professionals.
You"ll belong to a team responsible for management of data tagging and evaluation of model outputs as well as user acceptance testing, vendor management, and quality assurance, among other things.
You"ll build relationships through Bloomberg's dynamic and collaborative environment where you will work with engineering, among others, to ensure proper understanding of an attorney"s workflow and validate product builds.
We"ll invest in you, and coupled with our individualized approach to career development, we will help you expand your skills and opportunities.

You"ll need to have:

Graduated with a Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school.
Passed a state Bar examination and been admitted.
Minimum of 1-3 years relevant practice experience.
Familiarity with online legal research tools. Experience with the BLAW product is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including sophisticated concepts effectively.
Strong project management, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Self-starter and the ability to work with a high-degree of autonomy.
Interest in technology and development of technical skills.
Legal authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship now and in the future.

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Bloomberg is committed to diversity. It drives our innovation. At Bloomberg, you'll have the opportunity to go above and beyond and to take risks. You'll be a part of an organization that is entering new markets, launching new ventures, and pushing boundaries. Our ever-expanding array of technology, data, news, and media services champions innovation and empowers clients -- and offers nearly limitless opportunities for career growth.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We bring out the best in each other.

title: Statistical Programming Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
DPP is seeking a Statistical Programming Analyst for an opportunity in Columbia, SC.

Position Summary

Develops difficult statistical analysis using standard reporting, ad hoc reporting and data mining tools in order to identify patterns and trends.
Prepares charts, illustrations and other graphics and narrative reports to identify and explain data findings.
Required experience:

Professional experience with statistical programming and statistical interpretation practices, required, 4 years.
Experience with statistic backgrounds and data analysis.
Required education:

Bachelor’s degree or;
Master’s Degree Statistics/Biostatistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other job-related field.
Required skills and abilities:

Strong organizational, customer-service and analytical skills.
Ability to use complex mathematical calculations.
Demonstrated knowledge of mathematical or statistical concepts.
Relevant computer programming skills.
Microsoft Office skills.
Preferred experience:

Statistical analysis and computer programming experience with SAS, nonacademic preferred.
Relational database experience.
Professional data analysis experience and interpretation.
Job description:

Develops, maintains, and executes complex database programs for the extraction and presentation of data for standard and ad-hoc reporting.
Creates supporting documentation outlining all procedures within scope of responsibility.

Participates in writing of articles suitable for internal/external publication to support departmental efforts. May assume a leadership role in this activity.

industries: Accounting
description:
If you are a Data Quality Analyst who would like a 9-12 month Contract position with experience, please read on!

This is a REMOTE position, we are in New York City moving to a hybrid week, if you are in the tri-state (preference) and want to come in, great, if not you can be REMOTE!

We are a strong financial company building a brand new Data Quality team!

What You Will Be Doing

This team will be working through our financial databases, looking for any issues, performing root cause analysis and remediation and creating preventative measures. This is truly a data analysis position (not building reports) where you will be using your data analysis skills and technical abilities to to ensure the integrity of our data.

What You Need for this Position

Bachelor's degree in technical or quantitative discipline or relevant work experience

1+ years of project management experience working within or leading an initiative

We offer a long term contract assignment as we are building a brand new team!

title: Investigations Data Analyst, Physical Retail Investigations
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Software, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description

The Investigations Data Analyst, Physical Retail Investigations will provide support and analysis of investigation and resolution services pertaining to the protection of people, product, assets and data for Amazon. This individual will be responsible for proactively reviewing data, queries, and dashboards to identify anomalies and build out investigations. This individual will also be responsible for providing actionable recommendations derived from the data analysis and drive profitability through loss prevention and shrink improvement. This individual will be responsible for identifying investigative matters pertaining to the loss of merchandise, company assets, fraud, and other financial impacts to the business. This position will provide investigative insight, training, and process analysis for key business stakeholders. Additionally, this individual will look at strategic options to elevate the program and expand operations into new areas and opportunities. The Investigations Data Analyst is a key member of the investigations team. This position is based in Goodyear, Arizona and will report in to the Sr. Program Manager of Physical Retail Investigations, Strategic Investigative Solutions, Loss Prevention, Global Security Operations.

Key Responsibilities Include

Proactively identifies investigations through extracting data evidence from internal reporting, data analysis, store reported theft incidents, dashboards, queries, and theft trends (both internal and external).
Conduct root cause analysis to determine how to prevent future situations that lead to theft / fraud and influence operational best practices with key stakeholders
Create and maintain queries that identify anomalies for future investigative research.
Conduct extensive public records research and open source intelligence to support investigations
Prepare reports of investigative findings and communicates to key stakeholders.
Leverage fraud models/strategies to mitigate fraud/loss while minimizing customer and operations impact.
Develop, enhance, and track reporting on metrics which are key performance indicators, allowing performance improvements so that the desired outcomes are achieved to plan and in a timely manner.
Manages set expectations; prioritizing own workload and provides visibility and updates to manager regarding project timelines and deliverables.
Work with cross-functional teams across Amazon to collaborate on fraud risks and investigations
Ensure Internal Controls per Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) requirements related to area are fulfilled.
Conduct interviews when appropriate


Basic Qualifications

High School or equivalent diploma
1+ years of experience in law enforcement, loss prevention, asset protection
1+ years of data analysis/visualization/programming/queries (Tableau, SQL, etc.)
1+ years of MS Office Professional Suite, including intermediate knowledge of Excel
Commute and/or travel to store locations, as required
Work flexible hours including nights, weekends and holidays
Have the ability to lift up to 20 pounds with or without reasonable accommodation

Preferred Qualifications

Strong analytical leader with effective management and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions and implement effective solutions
Bachelor’s Degree in Criminal Justice or related field
Wicklander-Zulawski Certified
Loss Prevention Certified (LPC)
Detailed knowledge of theft and statutory laws/regulations
Experience with retail loss prevention and investigations
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. Writing skills are particularly important for this role
Knowledge of Amazon systems and retail store processes
Excellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines with the ability to multi-task when needed
Self-disciplined, diligent, proactive, and detail-oriented
Ability to be adaptable and flexible in responding to deadlines and workflow fluctuations
Experience working independently in an ambiguous environment with minimal supervision Excellent team player capable of learning and sharing knowledge in a global team environment

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:

Develops comprehensive reports and analyzes data in order to identify patterns and trends. Assists in creating materials that aid in illustrating analytical/data findings. Assists with sophisticated data interpretation, compilation, and verification to guide departmental efforts.

Description


40% Designs, codes, maintain and executes simple to complex database programs for the extraction and presentation of data for standard and ad hoc reporting. Utilizes statistical programming tools to identify patterns and trends in data. Assists in sampling design, sample selection, and relevant projections. Good organizational, customer service, and analytical skills.

Good oral and written communication skills.
Computer systems support knowledge.

title: Bioinformatics NGS Data Analyst
industries: Biotechnology Research and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
This role is with fortune 500 client:




Title: Bioinformatics NGS Data Analyst

Duration: 3 years

Location: Andover, MA

Job id: 23519-1




Description:

The qualified candidate will join the Analytical Research and Development Microbiology and Strategy Testing organization in Andover, MA, a QC (GMP) laboratory that supports biotherapeutic clinical manufacturing. Candidate will report directly to Microbiology Group Leader (Principal Scientist, Ph.D.).

We are recruiting an expert in molecular biology with experience in virology, next generation sequencing and bioinformatics to focus on developing rapid virus testing technologies. The project goals will include:

(1) Understanding the current industry virus assay requirements and capabilities

(2) Collaboration with established technology development partners.

(3) Development of a GMP method for the detection of adventitious viruses in biotherapeutics using Next Generation Sequencing (NGS).

(4) Method qualification design and execution.

(5) Successful implementation of the technology and training staff




Key Responsibilities:

Identify, develop, and implement new technologies to accelerate NGS workflows.

Prepare sequencing protocols, manage sequencer workflows and work in a highly collaborative environment to build out an NGS sequencing pipeline.

Develop and execute complex molecular biology protocols, specifically various NGS-based library preparation and characterization protocols, using established molecular biology techniques and Client solutions.

Extensive experience with molecular biology techniques such as DNA purification, RNA Extraction, PCR, NGS library preparation and quantification.

Provide technical support to the existing methods and analysis solutions.

Troubleshoot technical problems and participate in the continuing development and optimization of existing and new protocols.

Communicate with internal stakeholders to provide develop customs analysis solutions and provide troubleshooting support.

Adapts well to the changing platform needs, in workflow, projects and other tasks as required by the platform.

Keep records of development work and testing in a GMP environment utilizing electronic notebook solutions.

Follow standard operating procedures (SOPs) and current Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) on a daily basis.

Write technical reports and method/instrument SOPs.

Method and instrument qualification and validation.

Produce, analyze, and communicate scientific insights to the scientific and management teams.

Apply knowledge of sequencing to multiple cross functional NGS projects in a research and development setting.

Demonstrate the ability to resolve project hurdles by applying technical expertise in molecular biology.

Accountable for the accuracy, organization, and interpretation of testing results.

Interprets results and records observations. Identify and solve technical problems.

Experience with a broad range of lab techniques, including cell culture, cell-based assays, assay development would be a plus.

Represent the group at internal conferences.




Basic Qualifications:

Ph.D. in molecular biology, virology, bioengineering or related disciplines or a masters degree with a minimum of 4 years of relevant industry experience.

Minimum of 2 years experience with next generation sequencing workflow (including WGS, RNA-seq, and targeted sequencing), and bioinformatics analysis of NGS data.

Advanced understanding of NGS platforms, specifically those utilizing the synthesis by sequencing technique (i.e., Ion torrent and Illumina platforms).

Excellent understanding of the underlying technical principles of next generation sequencing chemistries and workflows, associated instrumentation platforms and data analysis and interpretation algorithms.

Expertise with basic molecular biology techniques (i.e., ligation, PCR, and qPCR) as well as nucleic acid extraction and analysis techniques (i.e., Nanodrop, DNA fragment analyzers, ddPCR, etc.).

Experience in assay and product development.

Practical method qualification and validation experience using quality by design.

Familiarity with instrument and software validation regulations.

Ability to work independently and adapt under aggressive and/or changing timelines.

Demonstrated ability to deliver high quality results independently and collaboratively.

Adaptive and a quick learner, efficient in multi-tasking and troubleshooting.




Preferred Qualifications:

Bioinformatics and statistics skills, including experience with Python or R (Scripting experience in coding languages (i.e., bash, awk, python, R, etc.) is preferred.

Familiarity with automation tools

Familiarity with eLN and LIMS system

Knowledge of and/or experience with other sequencing platforms (i.e., PacBio Sequel II).

Experience mentoring junior staff is highly preferred.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
Job Title: Data Quality Analyst

Location: Richardson,TX

Duration: Long term contract

 

Job Description: 

Experience - Data Governance and Data Stewardship
Self Starter with little training
Excellent Communication both written and verbal
Thinks quick on feet and out of the Box
In this role, the Data Quality Analyst on the data governance team will assist the business in making better decisions through collection and usage of data and ensuring our data is cared for through its complete lifecycle, as an enterprise asset.
Data Quality Analyst partners across various functional teams to ensure data is created, managed and effectively utilized as trusted enterprise assets. This role will also serve as the primary contact representative responsible for documenting definitions of data, ensuring the correct usage and context of data, enforcing policy/security/privacy requirements and maintaining data quality and integrity within a respective business data domain.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Understand the business processes to provide insights into critical data elements, their governance and management and drive consistent usage Involved in the creation or enhancement efforts of metadata repositories, data dictionaries, data quality rules, data lineage, reference data, functional process mapping efforts and related data governance procedures.
Work with business stakeholders to validate, create and run data quality rules for all governed data elements within their functional areas.
Help identify metadata-related inconsistencies across business areas and partner with business, product and engineering teams to build solutions.
Determine and monitor data quality metrics from data sources to measure applicable dimensions of completeness, accuracy and consistency of data.
Drive exploratory data analysis and provide results to Business Partners to drive value generating activities for managing risks and enhancing controls.
Conduct root-cause analysis for data defects, and support and promote its resolution.
Identify sensitive data and assist in classification and setting up a security framework for respective data domains.
Partner with Compliance and Data Privacy teams to analyze any impact from regulatory landscape changes across multiple regions

 

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in computer science, math, engineering or related field. Masters degree preferred.
3+ years of combined experience in data governance.
Experience includes working on data and data quality initiatives, aligning business processes with data, implementing technology solutions, developing or supporting standards / policies and data-related issue management and remediation efforts.
Experience with data management processes and tools and applications, including process mapping, profiling, creation of rules and building lineage (e.g. Collibra, Informatica Data Quality, Ataccama)
Experience interacting with various database and file storage systems (DB2, IDMS, Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL), data manipulation language (i.e. SQL), and/or data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI).
Advanced Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills including pivot tables, advanced charting, advanced formulas, conditional formatting
Excellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills with proven ability to establish and cultivate relationships with key partners
Motivated to understand and keep current with relevant Industry trends and best practices Strong critical thinking skills and ability to navigate.

title: Data Mapping Analyst
industries: Financial Services
description:
BSI Financial is a people-focused, growth-oriented, and innovative company. Make a positive change and join our team today.





Join BSI Financial Services as a Data Mapping Analyst. We are seeking a Data Mapping Analyst for Libretto, our SaaS reg-tech software for the mortgage industry. You will be responsible for mapping mortgage data between different client formats and the Libretto format, using industry-standard and Libretto-specific data mapping tools.





 





WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:






Competitive wages


Full Benefits Package


Generous Paid Time Off


Holiday Pay


401K


Career Growth Opportunities






 





WHAT YOU WILL DO:






Review and interpret simple to complex loan data to determine mapping requirements


Work with offshore development team to understand data mapping and technology requirements


Establish and maintain mapping documents and data dictionaries from Libretto clients


Collaborate closely with client data teams and Libretto Customer Success to ensure correct data mappings and address data integrity issues


Troubleshoot issues with loan mapping templates and identify process or technology solutions


Assist in the design, development, and automation of the loan mapping module within Libretto


Assist in the development of policies and procedures related to loan mapping tasks


Build loan mapping verification processes and scripts


Responsible for meeting legal requirements and following internal policies






 





WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:






BA/BS degree, preferably in Information Systems


At least two years of basic computer experience required


Experience working with mortgage data and ETL tools (preferred)


Strong technical orientation, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy


Strong interpersonal, coordination and multi-tasking skills


Ability to work independently and follow through to achieve desired results  


Adaptive learner, with the ability to work calmly under pressure and with tight deadlines


Ability to adapt and succeed in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment

title: Entry level data analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Computer and Network Security
description:
Roles & Responsibilities of a Data Analyst

Position Description:

As a Data Analyst you will be trained on Analytics, Data Engineering, Visualization and software applications associated and then get deployed on projects to the world class clients we serve. Campus hires begin their careers with TCS in the Initial Learning Program. A fully paid training program designed to provide you with the information and training necessary to succeed at TCS and excel at client sites. However, the learning does not stop there! TCS is committed to the continuous growth of its associates, in line with the core value of Learning & Sharing. We offer a Continuous Learning Program that spans technologies, domains, processes and soft skills. In addition, TCS associates are encouraged to undertake certifications and accreditations in a wide range of subject areas. With clients located across the US and globe, TCS can offer great flexibility in work location, excellent career advancement, and a variety of opportunities. TCS’ mentoring, career development, and on-the-job training ensure a smooth transition into your professional life and orient you to our culture, values, vision, and mission.

R esponsibilities:

· Work closely with IT and Business team to understand information requirements and business rules.

· Conduct data analysis as per project requirements

· Ability to convert business requirement into meaningful and explanatory visualization

· Understand and review various source specification documents and define data derivation and mapping rules for extracting data from various data sources

· Create mockup layout design and wireframes using visualization features available in Tableau

· Good in data Storytelling and chart optimization.

· Define data derivation and mapping rules for extracting data from various data sources.

· Ability to interpret data and analyze results using statistical technique's

Requirements:

· Computer Engineering (CE), Computer Science (CS) or Software Engineering (SE), Information Technology, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Math, Physics, Statistics

· Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher

· Knowledge of basic computer science concepts, programming, Information Systems. Knowledge of one programming language is a must (preferable Python)

· Strong Knowledge and experience of writing queries in SQL and query optimization

· Knowledge of statistics and basic data analytics concepts to derive information from data. Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques is a plus.

· Strong analytical ability to collect data from different sources, analyze it and present it to stakeholders

· Exposure to BI tools, Data Visualization, ETL concepts and application.

· Interest and willingness to travel and relocation

Qualifications:

· Outstanding attention to detail and capacity to demonstrate continual learning

· Exceptional analytical and problem solving capabilities

· Excellent deductive and inductive reasoning skills

· Strong interpersonal verbal and written skills

· Ability to work both individually and with teams

title: Data Analyst, Credit Risk
industries: Computer Software, Internet Publishing, and Financial Services
description:
We’re working on making the global financial system programmable. This is one of the largest opportunities for impact in the history of computing, on par with the rise of modern operating systems. Enabling the realization of this opportunity and simultaneously controlling our credit risk exposure, the Credit Risk team plays a critical role in the company’s financial health.

We’re looking for an experienced data analyst to partner with the Credit Risk team as well as our Merchant Intelligence team to drive the use of data to measure and limit our credit risk, ensure high-quality decisions, and point towards future opportunities. The ideal candidate has experience in credit risk data analysis, thinks creatively about measurement that leads to actionable outcomes, and values rigor in experimentation.

You Will

Work closely with the Credit Risk team to solve their most pressing challenges using data and insights
Focus on understanding the underlying needs of the Credit Risk team and working with them to design dashboards and metrics to address those needs
Use data to support the development of risk mitigation strategies and interventions while preserving and improving the user experience
Evolve our risk metrics, the datasets to support them, and the measurement of causal impact of initiatives to improve them
Effectively communicate the outcomes of your analysis to key stakeholders

You’d Ideally Have

3+ years experience in data analytics preferably related to credit risk
Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering)
Experience and passion for metrics and dashboard visualizations
Highly skilled at writing SQL to query relational databases; knowledge of R or Python and prior experience with writing and debugging data pipelines using a distributed data framework (Hadoop/Spark/Pig/etc.) a plus
Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills

title: Fraud Data Analyst - Austin
industries: Computers and Electronics
description:
Summary

Fraud Data Analysts play a meaningful role in driving and supporting the evolution of the business, working in lockstep with internal and external business partners. They have a strong understanding of fraud detection and prevention along with experience in one or more related verticals (e.g. digital e-commerce, credit issuance, loss forecasting). It’s a hands-on, cross-functional, highly-engaged job.

title: Data Privacy Analyst
industries: Online Media
description:
News Corp

News Corp is a global, diversified media and information services company focused on creating and distributing authoritative and engaging content to consumers throughout the world. The company comprises businesses across a range of media, including: news and information services, book publishing, digital real estate services, cable network programming in Australia, and pay-tv distribution in Australia.

Headquartered in New York, the activities of News Corp are conducted primarily in the United States, Australia, and the United Kingdom.

NYC - 1211 Ave of the Americas

Full time
Job_Req_27170

Data Privacy Analyst

News Corp HQ is looking for a Data Privacy Analyst to join the News Corp HQ Data Privacy team. The Data Privacy Analyst opportunity is an integral role within the News Corp HQ Global Data Privacy Office, working with individuals across the business to drive the global privacy program. The Data Privacy Analyst will have an understanding of data privacy and data protection issues and work collaboratively with privacy leadership and business stakeholders to manage data privacy operations, deliver practical advice, enable projects and enable privacy by design across the News Corp family of businesses. This Data Privacy Analyst will report to News Corp's Deputy Chief Privacy Officer. This role is full-time in NYC (remote work arrangements considered).

Job Description

Work with privacy counsel to further develop and operationalize News Corp's global data privacy program in compliance with global regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, Data Protection Act of 2018, CCPA, Australian Privacy Principles and other privacy regulations)
Leverage technology to develop regulatory compliance processes, including internal privacy tools for data mapping, cookie compliance, PIA/DPIA, Article 30 reports and DSAR response programs
Understand data types and flows across the businesses (systems, processes and vendors), and how these relate to policy and regulatory requirements
Assist business stakeholders with completing data inventory assessments, privacy impact assessments and other privacy assessments
Implement custom configuration of DSAR webforms/workflows, cookie compliance banners and dashboards
Support activities related to privacy initiatives and projects as needed, including technical configuration and implementation, user testing and creation of training materials
Communicate data privacy program standards and provide technical expertise to assist in implementing such standards
Proactively identify privacy risks in processes and systems and propose mitigations
Measure, verify, and perform analysis to report on performance and privacy operations effectiveness
Draft processes, procedures, documents, presentations and guidance as required
Continuously identify and communicate improvement opportunities


Relevant Experience

3+ years of project management and/or operations experience with a strong background in data privacy compliance
Understanding of global data privacy regulations, including GDPR and CCPA
Highly experienced with use and configuration of OneTrust
Strong technical acumen, including the ability to understand the technology landscape, identify opportunities, and overcome technical obstacles
Strong analytical skills; ability to understand and problem solve complex issues
Experience with working on complex, global projects as a project manager, working with multi-location and cross-functional teams
Experienced in documenting and implementing procedures and guidelines
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail at all times, even with the most routine tasks
Minimum bachelor's degree required
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, Word and the Google Suite of productivity tools
OneTrust Professional Certification required; CIPP certification a plus


About News Corp

News Corp is a global diversified media and information services company focused on creating and distributing authoritative and engaging content to consumers and businesses throughout the world. The company comprises businesses across a range of media, including: news and information services, book publishing, digital real estate services, cable network programming in Australia and pay-tv distribution in Australia.

title: Bioinformatics Data Analyst
industries: Computer Software, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry, by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

You will be on the front-lines developing responses to a variety of inquiries from our healthcare providers, collaborators, and patients. This position is responsible for compiling and analyzing data to respond to client inquiries.

What You’ll Do

Perform risk-based assessments of occurrences and urgent inquiries, drawing on molecular genetics and clinical testing experience to prioritize investigations while balancing customer needs against the team’s available resources
Aggregate and present data for root cause analysis and CAPAs as appropriate
Work closely with Lab Directors in collaboration with the Client Services, ClinConsult, and Medical teams to investigate and analyze issues and strive for utmost client satisfaction with the entire Invitae experience
Explore data to assess continuous process improvements following resolution of escalated inquiries in order to enhance internal processes and client satisfaction
Provide clear, concise written and oral communication including of technical findings to non-technical teammates
When laboratory issues are identified as a result of client inquiries, initiate incident reports and ensure appropriate documentation.

What You’ll Bring

Expert in Python data management and problem solving
Strong knowledge of querying databases: SQL, datalog, etc.
Knowledge of human molecular genetics and experience in a clinical testing laboratory
Understanding of NGS results, data analysis, and variant interpretation
Ability to understand customers’ questions and translate to an actionable analysis plan
Excellent trouble-shooting skills: Ability to successfully analyze problems and propose solutions to the medical escalation investigation leadership.
Experience working within a knowledge management and documentation management environment
Preference for industry experience in healthcare, biotech, and/or life sciences. Bonus: Familiarity and/or hands-on experience with DNA/RNA extraction and next-generation sequencing (NGS) wet lab protocols, preferably in a production setting.
Preferred PhD, MS or equivalent experience

At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Genomic Data Analyst
job_function: Information Technology, Quality Assurance, and Science
industries: Computer Software, Government Administration, and Public Policy Offices
description:
Kelly Government Solutions is a strategic supplier and business partner to the federal government and its key suppliers. Through our partnership with the National Institutes of Health, Kelly Government Solutions offers administrative, IT, engineering, scientific, and healthcare professionals the opportunity to work with the leading medical research center in the world. We are seeking a Data Analyst at the National Institutes of Health in Rockville, MD.







This is a long-term contract position which offers:

- Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit package

- Optional health, vision, and dental plans

- Vacation leave as well as 10 paid federal holidays and 401K plan.

- Access to NIH’s unparalleled resources and niche scientific initiatives







You should know: Vaccination against COVID-19 is a requirement for all job opportunities offered through Kelly Government Solutions, in accordance with the Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors.







TASKS/SERVICES. The contractor shall:

(1) Stay current on NIH policies related to genomic data sharing and participate on committees charged with the implementation of the policies

(2) Maintain databases and spreadsheets related to various programmatic data sharing activities

(3) Create and present data sharing training materials to program staff

(4) Maintain databases and spreadsheets for tracking and analyzing submission of datasets into the NIH’s Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP)

(5) Provide support for all data sharing related activities; create and maintain tracking systems and prepare reports to be presented to senior program leadership

(6) Create and distribute newsletters and educational materials for outside investigators

(7) Design, develop and maintain databases, Listservs, spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations and other computer applications

(8) Work with staff on meeting and workshop planning

(9) Work with staff on conducting literature reviews, particularly providing scientific expertise in the area of genetic epidemiology and genomic data sharing

(10) Undertake special assignments requiring fact-finding research; compose reports for use by staff

(11) Provide guidance to program staff and investigators on collecting the information required for genomic data sharing consistent with NIH policy; participate in meetings and conference calls, and handle correspondence with program staff and investigators







REQUIREMENTS. The contractor must have:

(1) Bachelor’s degree in a related field or Master's degree in a related field

(2) Minimum of four (4) years of related experience

(3) Knowledge of Genetic Epidemiology or related research or data driven field (Genomics research, Bioinformatics)

(4) Excellent analytical, organizational and time management skills.

(5) Knowledge of project management, organizing and tracking data and performing analyses

(6) Strong communications skills, both oral and written







PLEASE APPLY ONLINE

When you apply, please know a Kelly Government Solutions Recruiter will review your resume and will contact you directly, if your skills and experience match the requirements of this position; a full job description can be made available at that time.




Due to the high volume of inquiries, we regret that we cannot accept phone calls. Even if you aren’t contacted for this position, you are still part of our talent network. All Kelly recruiters have access to your profile, which expands your opportunities even further.




As a specialty talent company, Kelly is committed to doing the right thing for our talent and clients. We stand up for equity, inclusion, fair treatment, and opportunity for all as these build the foundation of our Talent Promise. With a focus on safety, value, well-being, investment, and opportunity, Kelly’s Talent Promise confirms our commitment to those in search of a better way to work and live and to help discover what’s next.




It is obvious things are different than they were just a few months ago. Kelly is at the forefront of ensuring the safety of our employees in this new working environment. Be well and stay strong.

title: Statistical Programming Analyst II
industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Summary

Develops comprehensive reports and analyzes data in order to identify patterns and trends. Assists in creating materials that aid in illustrating analytical/data findings. Assists with sophisticated data interpretation, compilation, and verification to guide departmental efforts.

Description


40% Designs, codes, maintain and executes simple to complex database programs for the extraction and presentation of data for standard and ad hoc reporting. Utilizes statistical programming tools to identify patterns and trends in data. Assists in sampling design, sample selection, and relevant projections. Performs statistical validations of sampling and related projections. Assists with the preparation of charts, illustrations, other graphics and narrative reports to explain findings.
30% Assists with development of complex statistical analysis, including standard reporting, AD HOC reporting, and data mining tools. Assists with sophisticated data interpretation, compilation, and verification to guide departmental efforts.
20% Provides assistance in development of project plans and system life cycle maintenance, development of change requests and test plans impacting existing databases, and in the research of new sources for data.
10% Verifies data in existing databases and assists in the collection of data and management of existing databases. Creates supporting documentation outlining procedures within scope of responsibility.

Required Education

Bachelor's or Master's degree Statistics/Biostatistics, mathematics, computer science, or other job related field

Required Work Experience

Two years statistical programming or statistical interpretation

Preferred Work Experience

Two years of experience with statistical practices.
Two years relational database experience (May be concurrent)
Professional SAS and Tableau experience

Good organizational, customer service, and analytical skills
Ability to use complex mathematical calculations
Demonstrated knowledge of mathematical or statistical concepts
Relevant computer programming skills

Preferred Skills And Abilities

Good oral and written communication skills
Computer systems support knowledge

Required Software And Tools

Microsoft Office

Preferred Software And Tools

SAS
Tableau
DB2

description:
Join BSI Financial Services as a Data Quality Assurance Analyst.





The goal of the Data Quality Assurance team is to ensure newly loaded loans are accurately setup for servicing. Analysts work directly with the Loan boarding team to verify data against loan documents. The analyst will gain experience with multiple loan types and servicing files. In addition to reviewing documents, the analyst will also monitor illogical condition dashboards on BSI’s Analytics system called Asset360.





 





Position Type and Expected Hours of Work





This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m., overtime may be required

Performs a data to doc comparison of new loans to ensure data accuracy


Provides quality assurance with direction and guidance necessary to maintain compliance


Works directly with the loan boarding team on new product setup and provides guidance to ensure loan products are setup accurately. 


Monitors illogical condition dashboards and implements corrective action on data integrity issues.


Acts as an extension of the Loan Boarding group to isolate data mapping issues prior to the loans being loaded to the BSI system







Responsible for meeting legal requirements and following internal policies






 





WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:






Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint & Word)


Must be able to read, comprehend, and act upon various forms of information received from internal and external sources.

Collaborates effectively with inter-departmental teams to achieve organizational goals


Exhibits strong verbal and written communication skills,


Critical/Logistical thinking skills


Ability to multi-task & prioritize effectively and efficiently


Identify Issues and create resolutions quickly


Must be composed and professional under pressure, in fast paced work environment

title: Data Analyst for Mass Spectrometry Proteomics
industries: Biotechnology Research, Hospitals and Health Care, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Program Description

The Cancer Research Technology Program (CRTP) develops and implements emerging technology, cancer biology expertise and research capabilities to accomplish NCI research objectives. The CRTP is an outward-facing, multi-disciplinary hub purposed to enable the external cancer research community and provides dedicated support to NCI's intramural Center for Cancer Research (CCR). The dedicated units provide expertise in electron microscopy, protein characterization, mass spectrometry, protein expression, optical microscopy, and genomics. These research efforts are an integral part of CCR at the Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research (FNLCR), where CRTP scientists work collaboratively with intramural NCI investigators to provide research technologies and expertise.

Key Roles/Responsibilities

Analyze data produced by a high throughput mass spectrometry proteomics laboratory
Interact productively and constructively with scientists performing mass spectrometry proteomics experiments
Produce detailed findings, figures, and presentations for discussion with mass spectrometry scientists
Comprehensive data analysis using variety of different methods and software, such as Proteome Discoverer, Spectronaut, Skyline, and etc.
Develop new proteomics and data analytical methods
Summarize and present key results at project reviews meetings and contribute and write manuscripts for per review publications

Basic Qualifications

To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:

Possession of Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university according to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) in biochemistry, analytical chemistry, or other related discipline or four (4) years relevant experience in lieu of degree. Foreign degrees must be evaluated for U.S. equivalency
In addition to the education requirement, a minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible experience
More than three years of MS-based data analysis experience in mass spectrometry proteomics
Solid understanding of programs used to analyze mass spectrometry proteomics data
Strong theoretical understanding of both global and targeted mass spectrometry proteomics and bioinformatic methods to interpret and validate findings
Experience using several of the listed MS software suites for proteomics workflow analysis, such as Xcalibur, free style, Proteome Discoverer, MSGF+, Spectronaut, Skyline, etc.
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Preferred Qualifications

Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:

M.S. degree in biochemistry, analytical chemistry or other related discipline from an accredited college or university according to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation
2 years of related post graduate MS-based proteomic experience Data Analyst II
5-years for Data Analyst III
Experience with multivariate analysis techniques such as Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) and cluster analysis
Experience with programming languages or platforms such as Python, R, or Matlab
Experience analyzing global and/or targeted proteomic data
Experience with producing and interpreting proteomic graphical displays, such as heat maps and volcano plots

title: Data Analyst, Credit Risk
industries: Computer Software, Internet Publishing, and Financial Services
description:
We’re working on making the global financial system programmable. This is one of the largest opportunities for impact in the history of computing, on par with the rise of modern operating systems. Enabling the realization of this opportunity and simultaneously controlling our credit risk exposure, the Credit Risk team plays a critical role in the company’s financial health.

We’re looking for an experienced data analyst to partner with the Credit Risk team as well as our Merchant Intelligence team to drive the use of data to measure and limit our credit risk, ensure high-quality decisions, and point towards future opportunities. The ideal candidate has experience in credit risk data analysis, thinks creatively about measurement that leads to actionable outcomes, and values rigor in experimentation.

You Will

Work closely with the Credit Risk team to solve their most pressing challenges using data and insights
Focus on understanding the underlying needs of the Credit Risk team and working with them to design dashboards and metrics to address those needs
Use data to support the development of risk mitigation strategies and interventions while preserving and improving the user experience
Evolve our risk metrics, the datasets to support them, and the measurement of causal impact of initiatives to improve them
Effectively communicate the outcomes of your analysis to key stakeholders

You’d Ideally Have

3+ years experience in data analytics preferably related to credit risk
Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering)
Experience and passion for metrics and dashboard visualizations
Highly skilled at writing SQL to query relational databases; knowledge of R or Python and prior experience with writing and debugging data pipelines using a distributed data framework (Hadoop/Spark/Pig/etc.) a plus
Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills

A fully paid training program designed to provide you with the information and training necessary to succeed at TCS and excel at client sites. However, the learning does not stop there! TCS is committed to the continuous growth of its associates, in line with the core value of Learning & Sharing. We offer a Continuous Learning Program that spans technologies, domains, processes and soft skills. In addition, TCS associates are encouraged to undertake certifications and accreditations in a wide range of subject areas. With clients located across the US and globe, TCS can offer great flexibility in work location, excellent career advancement, and a variety of opportunities. TCS’ mentoring, career development, and on-the-job training ensure a smooth transition into your professional life and orient you to our culture, values, vision, and mission.

Responsibilities:

Work closely with IT and Business team to understand information requirements and business rules.
Conduct data analysis as per project requirements
Ability to convert business requirement into meaningful and explanatory visualization
Understand and review various source specification documents and define data derivation and mapping rules for extracting data from various data sources
Create mockup layout design and wireframes using visualization features available in Tableau
Good in data Storytelling and chart optimization.
Define data derivation and mapping rules for extracting data from various data sources.
Ability to interpret data and analyze results using statistical technique's

Requirements:

Computer Engineering (CE), Computer Science (CS) or Software Engineering (SE), Information Technology, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Math, Physics, Statistics
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
Knowledge of basic computer science concepts, programming, Information Systems. Knowledge of one programming language is a must (preferable Python)
Strong Knowledge and experience of writing queries in SQL and query optimization
Knowledge of statistics and basic data analytics concepts to derive information from data. Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques is a plus.
Strong analytical ability to collect data from different sources, analyze it and present it to stakeholders
Exposure to BI tools, Data Visualization, ETL concepts and application.
Interest and willingness to travel and relocation

Qualifications:

Outstanding attention to detail and capacity to demonstrate continual learning
Exceptional analytical and problem solving capabilities
Excellent deductive and inductive reasoning skills
Strong interpersonal verbal and written skills
Ability to work both individually and with teams

Thanks & Regards

title: Bioinformatics Data Analyst
industries: Computer Software, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry, by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

You will be on the front-lines developing responses to a variety of inquiries from our healthcare providers, collaborators, and patients. This position is responsible for compiling and analyzing data to respond to client inquiries.

What You’ll Do

Perform risk-based assessments of occurrences and urgent inquiries, drawing on molecular genetics and clinical testing experience to prioritize investigations while balancing customer needs against the team’s available resources
Aggregate and present data for root cause analysis and CAPAs as appropriate
Work closely with Lab Directors in collaboration with the Client Services, ClinConsult, and Medical teams to investigate and analyze issues and strive for utmost client satisfaction with the entire Invitae experience
Explore data to assess continuous process improvements following resolution of escalated inquiries in order to enhance internal processes and client satisfaction
Provide clear, concise written and oral communication including of technical findings to non-technical teammates
When laboratory issues are identified as a result of client inquiries, initiate incident reports and ensure appropriate documentation.

What You’ll Bring

Expert in Python data management and problem solving
Strong knowledge of querying databases: SQL, datalog, etc.
Knowledge of human molecular genetics and experience in a clinical testing laboratory
Understanding of NGS results, data analysis, and variant interpretation
Ability to understand customers’ questions and translate to an actionable analysis plan
Excellent trouble-shooting skills: Ability to successfully analyze problems and propose solutions to the medical escalation investigation leadership.
Experience working within a knowledge management and documentation management environment
Preference for industry experience in healthcare, biotech, and/or life sciences. Bonus: Familiarity and/or hands-on experience with DNA/RNA extraction and next-generation sequencing (NGS) wet lab protocols, preferably in a production setting.
Preferred PhD, MS or equivalent experience

At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Genomic Data Analyst
job_function: Information Technology, Quality Assurance, and Science
industries: Computer Software, Government Administration, and Public Policy Offices
description:
Kelly Government Solutions is a strategic supplier and business partner to the federal government and its key suppliers. Through our partnership with the National Institutes of Health, Kelly Government Solutions offers administrative, IT, engineering, scientific, and healthcare professionals the opportunity to work with the leading medical research center in the world. We are seeking a Data Analyst at the National Institutes of Health in Rockville, MD.







This is a long-term contract position which offers:

- Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit package

- Optional health, vision, and dental plans

- Vacation leave as well as 10 paid federal holidays and 401K plan.

- Access to NIH’s unparalleled resources and niche scientific initiatives







You should know: Vaccination against COVID-19 is a requirement for all job opportunities offered through Kelly Government Solutions, in accordance with the Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors.







TASKS/SERVICES. The contractor shall:

(1) Stay current on NIH policies related to genomic data sharing and participate on committees charged with the implementation of the policies

(2) Maintain databases and spreadsheets related to various programmatic data sharing activities

(3) Create and present data sharing training materials to program staff

(4) Maintain databases and spreadsheets for tracking and analyzing submission of datasets into the NIH’s Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP)

(5) Provide support for all data sharing related activities; create and maintain tracking systems and prepare reports to be presented to senior program leadership

(6) Create and distribute newsletters and educational materials for outside investigators

(7) Design, develop and maintain databases, Listservs, spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations and other computer applications

(8) Work with staff on meeting and workshop planning

(9) Work with staff on conducting literature reviews, particularly providing scientific expertise in the area of genetic epidemiology and genomic data sharing

(10) Undertake special assignments requiring fact-finding research; compose reports for use by staff

(11) Provide guidance to program staff and investigators on collecting the information required for genomic data sharing consistent with NIH policy; participate in meetings and conference calls, and handle correspondence with program staff and investigators







REQUIREMENTS. The contractor must have:

(1) Bachelor’s degree in a related field or Master's degree in a related field

(2) Minimum of four (4) years of related experience

(3) Knowledge of Genetic Epidemiology or related research or data driven field (Genomics research, Bioinformatics)

(4) Excellent analytical, organizational and time management skills.

(5) Knowledge of project management, organizing and tracking data and performing analyses

(6) Strong communications skills, both oral and written







PLEASE APPLY ONLINE

When you apply, please know a Kelly Government Solutions Recruiter will review your resume and will contact you directly, if your skills and experience match the requirements of this position; a full job description can be made available at that time.




Due to the high volume of inquiries, we regret that we cannot accept phone calls. Even if you aren’t contacted for this position, you are still part of our talent network. All Kelly recruiters have access to your profile, which expands your opportunities even further.




As a specialty talent company, Kelly is committed to doing the right thing for our talent and clients. We stand up for equity, inclusion, fair treatment, and opportunity for all as these build the foundation of our Talent Promise. With a focus on safety, value, well-being, investment, and opportunity, Kelly’s Talent Promise confirms our commitment to those in search of a better way to work and live and to help discover what’s next.




It is obvious things are different than they were just a few months ago. Kelly is at the forefront of ensuring the safety of our employees in this new working environment. Be well and stay strong.
