title: Statistical Programming Analyst II
industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Summary

Develops comprehensive reports and analyzes data in order to identify patterns and trends. Assists in creating materials that aid in illustrating analytical/data findings. Assists with sophisticated data interpretation, compilation, and verification to guide departmental efforts.

Description


40% Designs, codes, maintain and executes simple to complex database programs for the extraction and presentation of data for standard and ad hoc reporting. Utilizes statistical programming tools to identify patterns and trends in data. Assists in sampling design, sample selection, and relevant projections. Performs statistical validations of sampling and related projections. Assists with the preparation of charts, illustrations, other graphics and narrative reports to explain findings.
30% Assists with development of complex statistical analysis, including standard reporting, AD HOC reporting, and data mining tools. Assists with sophisticated data interpretation, compilation, and verification to guide departmental efforts.
20% Provides assistance in development of project plans and system life cycle maintenance, development of change requests and test plans impacting existing databases, and in the research of new sources for data.
10% Verifies data in existing databases and assists in the collection of data and management of existing databases. Creates supporting documentation outlining procedures within scope of responsibility.

Required Education

Bachelor's or Master's degree Statistics/Biostatistics, mathematics, computer science, or other job related field

Required Work Experience

Two years statistical programming or statistical interpretation

Preferred Work Experience

Two years of experience with statistical practices.
Two years relational database experience (May be concurrent)
Professional SAS and Tableau experience

Required Skills And Abilities

Good organizational, customer service, and analytical skills
Ability to use complex mathematical calculations
Demonstrated knowledge of mathematical or statistical concepts
Relevant computer programming skills

Preferred Skills And Abilities

Good oral and written communication skills
Computer systems support knowledge

Required Software And Tools

Microsoft Office

Preferred Software And Tools

SAS
Tableau
DB2

title: Data Quality Assurance Analyst
industries: Financial Services
description:
Join BSI Financial Services as a Data Quality Assurance Analyst.





The goal of the Data Quality Assurance team is to ensure newly loaded loans are accurately setup for servicing. Analysts work directly with the Loan boarding team to verify data against loan documents. The analyst will gain experience with multiple loan types and servicing files. In addition to reviewing documents, the analyst will also monitor illogical condition dashboards on BSI’s Analytics system called Asset360.





 





Position Type and Expected Hours of Work





This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m., overtime may be required





 





WHAT WILL YOU DO:                                                                                                                                          






Performs a data to doc comparison of new loans to ensure data accuracy


Provides quality assurance with direction and guidance necessary to maintain compliance


Works directly with the loan boarding team on new product setup and provides guidance to ensure loan products are setup accurately. 


Monitors illogical condition dashboards and implements corrective action on data integrity issues.


Acts as an extension of the Loan Boarding group to isolate data mapping issues prior to the loans being loaded to the BSI system







Responsible for meeting legal requirements and following internal policies






 





WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:






Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint & Word)


Must be able to read, comprehend, and act upon various forms of information received from internal and external sources.


An associate degree or higher or 2 years minimum related work experience preferred


Knowledge of different Mortgage Products: Fixed Rate/ARM/Balloon/Heloc/Option Arms, preferred


Ability to think analytically, understand the business products, and escalate problem areas.


Demonstrates ability to take initiative and follow through on projects


Collaborates effectively with inter-departmental teams to achieve organizational goals


Exhibits strong verbal and written communication skills,


Critical/Logistical thinking skills


Ability to multi-task & prioritize effectively and efficiently


Identify Issues and create resolutions quickly


Must be composed and professional under pressure, in fast paced work environment




EEO Statement



We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Analyst for Mass Spectrometry Proteomics
industries: Biotechnology Research, Hospitals and Health Care, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Program Description

The Cancer Research Technology Program (CRTP) develops and implements emerging technology, cancer biology expertise and research capabilities to accomplish NCI research objectives. The CRTP is an outward-facing, multi-disciplinary hub purposed to enable the external cancer research community and provides dedicated support to NCI's intramural Center for Cancer Research (CCR). The dedicated units provide expertise in electron microscopy, protein characterization, mass spectrometry, protein expression, optical microscopy, and genomics. These research efforts are an integral part of CCR at the Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research (FNLCR), where CRTP scientists work collaboratively with intramural NCI investigators to provide research technologies and expertise.

Key Roles/Responsibilities

Analyze data produced by a high throughput mass spectrometry proteomics laboratory
Interact productively and constructively with scientists performing mass spectrometry proteomics experiments
Produce detailed findings, figures, and presentations for discussion with mass spectrometry scientists
Comprehensive data analysis using variety of different methods and software, such as Proteome Discoverer, Spectronaut, Skyline, and etc.
Develop new proteomics and data analytical methods
Summarize and present key results at project reviews meetings and contribute and write manuscripts for per review publications

Basic Qualifications

To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:

Possession of Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university according to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) in biochemistry, analytical chemistry, or other related discipline or four (4) years relevant experience in lieu of degree. Foreign degrees must be evaluated for U.S. equivalency
In addition to the education requirement, a minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible experience
More than three years of MS-based data analysis experience in mass spectrometry proteomics
Solid understanding of programs used to analyze mass spectrometry proteomics data
Strong theoretical understanding of both global and targeted mass spectrometry proteomics and bioinformatic methods to interpret and validate findings
Experience using several of the listed MS software suites for proteomics workflow analysis, such as Xcalibur, free style, Proteome Discoverer, MSGF+, Spectronaut, Skyline, etc.
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Preferred Qualifications

Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:

M.S. degree in biochemistry, analytical chemistry or other related discipline from an accredited college or university according to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation
2 years of related post graduate MS-based proteomic experience Data Analyst II
5-years for Data Analyst III
Experience with multivariate analysis techniques such as Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) and cluster analysis
Experience with programming languages or platforms such as Python, R, or Matlab
Experience analyzing global and/or targeted proteomic data
Experience with producing and interpreting proteomic graphical displays, such as heat maps and volcano plots

title: Quality Assurance Data Analyst (MN or remote within the U.S.)
industries: Medical Equipment, Hospitals and Health Care, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Open to remote within the United States with preference to Minnesota.

Careers that Change Lives

A career at Medtronic is like no other. We’re purposeful. We’re committed. And we’re driven by our Mission to alleviate pain, restore health and extend life for millions of people worldwide.

In this exciting role as a Quality Assurance Data Analyst, you will have responsibility to transform the way we look at outputs of our complaint, FCA and PHO processes. You will partner to develop innovative methods/techniques to proactively capture potential quality or compliance gaps for Customer Quality to act on. The candidate will provide analytics and insights that will help optimize quality performance and drive decision making to improve complaint, FCA and PHO outputs.

A Day in the Life

Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned:

Develops, inspects, mines, transforms, and models data to raise productivity, improve decision making, and gain competitive advantage.
Conducts statistical analysis on data and information to ensure correct predictive forecasting or classification.
Manages all aspects of end-to-end data processing utilizing customized report building functions of systems.
Maintains analytical systems, verifies the accuracy of the data, and acts as a liaison to the business.
Partners with Data Science and CQ Technology team members to explore and implement methodologies to understand performance.
Identifies and implements innovative techniques / methods to provide insight for improved quality and compliance
Travel requirement: less than 25%

Must Have: Minimum Requirements

Bachelor's degree with 2+ years of work experience in Quality or regulated industry OR Advanced degree with 0+ years of work experience in Quality or regulated industry.

Nice to Have

Knowledge of and direct experience working with signal processing and machine learning methodologies
Demonstrated ability to work within a team-based project environment
Experience with trending and analysis of complex data from multiple sources
Experience interacting with a multi-disciplinary, cross-functional team
Experience utilizing statistical methods to inform decision making
Experience working in a regulated industry
Quality focus, willingness to learn, versatility and adaptability

About Medtronic

Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

Physical Job Requirements

The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)

Additional Information

Posting Date: Oct 18, 2021
Travel: Yes, < 25 % of the Time

title: Data Analyst, Credit Risk
industries: Computer Software, Internet Publishing, and Financial Services
description:
We’re working on making the global financial system programmable. This is one of the largest opportunities for impact in the history of computing, on par with the rise of modern operating systems. Enabling the realization of this opportunity and simultaneously controlling our credit risk exposure, the Credit Risk team plays a critical role in the company’s financial health.

We’re looking for an experienced data analyst to partner with the Credit Risk team as well as our Merchant Intelligence team to drive the use of data to measure and limit our credit risk, ensure high-quality decisions, and point towards future opportunities. The ideal candidate has experience in credit risk data analysis, thinks creatively about measurement that leads to actionable outcomes, and values rigor in experimentation.

You Will

Work closely with the Credit Risk team to solve their most pressing challenges using data and insights
Focus on understanding the underlying needs of the Credit Risk team and working with them to design dashboards and metrics to address those needs
Use data to support the development of risk mitigation strategies and interventions while preserving and improving the user experience
Evolve our risk metrics, the datasets to support them, and the measurement of causal impact of initiatives to improve them
Effectively communicate the outcomes of your analysis to key stakeholders

You’d Ideally Have

3+ years experience in data analytics preferably related to credit risk
Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering)
Experience and passion for metrics and dashboard visualizations
Highly skilled at writing SQL to query relational databases; knowledge of R or Python and prior experience with writing and debugging data pipelines using a distributed data framework (Hadoop/Spark/Pig/etc.) a plus
Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills

Show more Show less

title: Pharmacy Data Analyst (Remote)
industries: Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

Pharmacy Data Analyst with experience utilizing Claims, Network, Rebate, and other supplemental Rx data sources. Designs and implements processes and solutions associated with a wide variety of data sets used for data/text mining, analysis, modeling, and predicting to enable informed business decisions. Gains insight into key business problems and deliverables by applying statistical analysis techniques to examine structured and unstructured data from multiple disparate sources. Collaborates across departments and with customers to define requirements and understand business problems. Uses advanced mathematical, statistical, querying, and reporting methods to develop solutions. Develops information tools, algorithms, dashboards, and queries to monitor and improve business performance. Creates solutions from initial concept to fully tested production, and communicates results to a broad range of audiences. Effectively uses current and emerging technologies.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Extracts and compiles various sources of information and large data sets from various systems to identify and analyze outliers.
Sets up process for monitoring, tracking, and trending department data.
Prepares any state mandated reports and analysis.
Works with internal, external and enterprise clients as needed to research, develop, and document new standard reports or processes.
Implements and uses the analytics software and systems to support the departments goals.
Flow charting.
Tableau visualizations.
Effort management: Facilitate meetings to gather requestor requirements, status updates, working with our support groups (EIM), and occasional client surveying.
UM Data Analysis to provide insights into PA review TAT, consistency of decision, and overall trending.
Pharmacy and medical claims analysis to identify trends in utilization.
Pharmacy and medical claims analysis to identify gaps in care.
Pharmacy and medical claims help manage drug spend and quality of care provided to members.
Documentation - BRDs, RRDs, SOP's.

Required Education

Job Qualifications

Associate's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Required Experience

1-3 years of clinical data and statistical analysis experience utilizing claims, network, rebate and other supplemental Rx data sources.
Must be able to read and write SQL queries.
Must have experience with visualization tools (e.g. Tableau and PowerBI).
Must be familiar with pharmacy data (e.g. pharmacy claims).
Excel experience (e.g. Pivot Tables, Graphs,Flow Charts, Advanced Formulas, Power Query, VLookup, etc...).

Preferred Education

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Preferred Experience

3-5 years of clinical data and statistical analysis experience.
Familiar with supplemental pharmacy data (e.g. Medispan).
SAS.

Job Title: Associate (entry level) Data Analyst – Remote (JP9432)

Location: Thousand Oaks, CA. (100% REMOTE)

Employment Type: Contract

Business Unit: Commercial Discounts

Duration: 5+ months (with likely extensions and/or conversion to permanent)

Posting Date: 11/16/2021

Rate: $20-25/hr

3 Key Consulting is hiring an Associate Managed Care Contract Compliance for a consulting engagement with our direct client, a leading global biopharmaceutical company.

Job Description

The successful candidate for this data-focused position will be responsible for ensuring Contract Compliance by cross-checking Managed Care Rebate Invoice submissions against Formulary Validation results and proactively identifying claims for dispute. Additionally, you will work in concert and at the direction of your direct supervisor to coordinate your work with theirs to ensure payments are made accurately and timely. This role will require you to work cross-functionally with partners from Payor Contracting and Market Access and will require active participation in regular status meetings, for which you will be responsible for taking and distributing meeting minutes. Additionally, you will be responsible for maintaining dispute status tracker as well as other tasks as assigned.

Why is the Position Open?

Needing additional cover; special project.

Top Must Have Skills

Must have 1-2 years' experience working with large data sets.
Basic understanding of prescription drug coverage.
Intermediate Excel skills, and tech savvy.
Great communicational skills.

Basic Qualifications

B.S. degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Sciences or related discipline.
Min 1-2 years' experience working with large data sets.
Basic understanding of prescription drug coverage.
Intermediate Excel skills

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Managed Care, PBMs, or other payors, and in depth understanding of prescription drug coverage in the US.
Advanced MS Excel skills
Demonstrate independence and ability to produce quality results while meeting tight deadlines under minimal direction
Generate complete, accurate, and concise documentation.
High energy individual who can multi-task and handle a fast-pace, dynamic work environment
Take detailed meeting minutes
Actively participate in cross-functional meetings which will require effective communication across various levels of the organization
Perform analysis on data sets
Maintain dispute status tracker
Work in partnership with direct supervisor to ensure smooth handoffs of work.

Employee Value Proposition

Great team dynamic
Collaborative team
Opportunity to growth and learn new skill sets
Facetime with leadership and management

Red Flags

No excel experience; must have strong experience in Excel (more than basic skills), formula driven
Not driven or willing to learn new things
Must be able to multitask

Interview Process

Video Skype Panel Interview

We invite qualified candidates to send your resume to resumes@3keyconsulting.com. If you decide that you’re not interested in pursuing this particular position, please feel free to take a look at the other positions on our website www.3keyconsulting.com/careers. You are also welcome to share this opportunity with anyone you think might be interested in applying for this role.

Regards,

3KC Talent Acquisition Team

title: Quality Assurance Data Analyst
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Quality Assurance Data Analyst to join us to ensure we build a quality product as we continue to grow our predictive analytics business. As a Quality Assurance Data Analyst, you will get to:




Interpret, build upon, and comply with company quality assurance standards. Carefully maintain complaint and nonconformance processing through records and tracking systems, including root cause and corrective actions
Develop new standards for production and design, with improvements as needed, and create testing protocols for implementation across all service lines
Collaborate with the Benchmark Research Team members across the organization that focus on improving product data quality, data pipeline efficiency and data platform performance




If you are interested in the intersection of public sector operations, research and data analytics, we believe this is an unprecedented opportunity to experience it first-hand.




Responsibilities:

Working with leadership and peers to:

Ensure data and analytics engineering team delivers a high quality, scalable and maintainable product.
Manage code change in a robust, secure manner.
Plan, execute, and oversee the testing of incoming and outgoing data to confirm accuracy and conformance to specifications.
Track, document, and report quality levels.
Develop or update company complaint and inspection procedures to ensure documentation, inspection, and resolution of complaints.
Analyze and investigate product complaints/issues to ensure closure in accordance with company requirements.
Provide training and support to quality assurance team on systems, policies, procedures, and core processes.
Facilitate product ownership and scrum activates
Partner with cross-functional team members to collect and document detailed product requirements.
Build in-depth product knowledge to identify product improvement opportunities through agile scrum activities




Requirements:

The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally organized, methodical professional with the experience necessary to take our products to the next level with respect to accuracy, security, and safety. You will be charged with developing a complete QA program that not only safeguards the quality of our products, but also fosters a “quality culture”, in which all employees become actively engaged in guaranteeing quality in both production and the finished product.

Bachelor’s degree
Professional certification, such as Six Sigma, Quality Engineer, or Quality Auditor

Who You Are:

Superb computer competence, including database management
Knowledge of quality assurance terminology, methods, and tools
Analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
Demonstrated knowledge of testing best practices, version control practices and defect management practice
Understanding of Agile/Scrum methodology and how QA functions within it
Works and communicates well with others:
Has empathy for colleagues and customers
Able to receive and respond positively to feedback
Able to work independently with reasonable guidance from management (except in complex and non-routine situations)
Able to effectively communicate across multiple levels (team members, managers) in a fast-paced environment




Who We Are:

Founded by a group of seasoned entrepreneurs, Benchmark Analytics is a SaaS technology startup housed in the Ravenswood technology corridor on Chicago’s Northside. In partnership with the University of Chicago (who is part owner of our company), we are building a predictive analytics platform for law enforcement human capital management. Our series of predictive tools help police departments support officers along a wellness continuum and provides individualized, research-based interventions and supports.




We are a double-bottom line company – our management team is comprised of former police officers, former city officials, and current change makers who believe in (and have witnessed) the power of data to transform government….and in this case, improve policing. If you are interested in the intersection of public sector operations, research and data analytics, and building amazing software we believe this is an unprecedented opportunity to experience it first-hand. We’re an agile, fast-growing company and you’ll get to do much more as the company grows.




What We Offer:

A truly unique experience to work for a fast-growing company with a purpose
The satisfaction that comes with being part of a solution that is making a difference within the institution of policing and law enforcement
The excitement that comes with the need to endlessly innovate and transform our market
We cover 75% of Medical (BCBS) Premiums, Dental & Vision Premiums, and offer 100% company sponsored Life Insurance as well as a 401k plan
Unlimited PTO




The Fine Print and How to Apply:

Thank you for your interest in our company and what we are building!

Benchmark Analytics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all kinds in our effort to create a stellar workforce of committed and passionate team members.
Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, so we can only accept applications from candidates who are authorized to work in the US.
If you’d like to apply, please email your resume to nick.montgomery@benchmarkanalytics.com.

title: Data Analyst, Entry-Level
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet Publishing
description:
About The Team

At DoorDash, we’re building the future of on-demand delivery. Our world-class team of Data Scientists is passionate about creating opportunities for others to become the next generation of data-driven decision-makers at DoorDash. Many of our best Data Scientists had no experience prior to transferring into the role. This is an excellent opportunity to jumpstart your Analytics career.

About The Role

Our goal is to develop our entry-level Data Analysts into thoughtful and strategic leaders. This means designing and running experiments in your first quarter at DoorDash, quickly becoming a SQL expert, developing your data storytelling abilities, and working alongside seasoned data scientists who will guide you in developing necessary skills on the job. As a Data Analyst at DoorDash, you'll use your quantitative reasoning skills to dive into large datasets to guide decision-making. We tackle a multitude of exciting challenges including customer acquisition, fraud, and support, marketing, balancing supply and demand, new city launches, marketplace efficiency, and more. If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos and want to learn how to use analytics to affect revenue, growth, operations, or beyond, we’re looking for someone like you!

You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…

Get your start in Analytics and learn the ropes from seasoned Data Scientists. You’ll have important problems to solve from day one.
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business.
Own the end-to-end experimentation process from opportunity identification and experimentation design to analyzing results and recommending next steps.
Build full-cycle analytics experiments, reports, and dashboards using SQL, R, Python, or other scripting and statistical tools.
Produce recommendations and use exploratory data analysis techniques to validate your findings.
Provide insights to help business and product leaders understand marketplace dynamics, user behaviors, and long-term trends.
Identify and measure product and business levers to focus our roadmap on moving key metrics
Work backward from understanding and sizing problems to ideating solutions
Report against our goals by identifying essential metrics and building executive-facing dashboards to track progress
Collaborate with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging
Be a part of DoorDash’s first entry-level Analytics program!

We’re Excited About You Because…

A degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Biology, Chemistry, or equivalent exposure to a quantitative domain
Curiosity about our business and products, and how we can improve them using data, analysis, and experimentation
High-level understanding of analytical concepts like funnel optimization, user segmentation, cohort analyses, time series analyses, regression models, etc
Basic knowledge of a data or scripting language (e.g., SQL, Python, R, matlab, etc.) and the desire to quickly develop mastery of SQL
Basic working knowledge of data manipulation and visualization techniques
Familiarity with statistical concepts related to experiment design, hypothesis testing, and predictive modeling
The insight to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way
The determination to initiate and lead projects to completion in a scrappy environment
Prior experience, including internships, in data analytics, consulting, or related quantitative role is a plus but not required

Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders – Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.

We are operators – We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions to lead our company and our industry is what we do on every project, every day.

We are learners – Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute. We are committed to learning and implementing what is best for our customers, merchants, and dashers.

We are one team – The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.

About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly and always learn and reiterate to support merchants, Dashers and the communities we serve. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods. Read more on the DoorDash website, the DoorDash blog, the DoorDash Engineering blog, and the DoorDash Careers page.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. Our leaders seek the truth and welcome big, hairy, audacious questions. We are grounded in our company values, and we make intentional decisions that are both logical and display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to Merchants to Customers.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, the base salary range in Colorado for this position is $86,000 to $129,000 per year, plus opportunities for equity and commission. Compensation in other geographies may vary. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel. Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

title: Analyst, Data Insights
industries: Entertainment
description:
Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.

Join us. Shape your story here.

THE JOB

The Distribution Analytics & Insights team is responsible for developing analyses to enable strategic and operational decision-making across WarnerMedia’s streaming brands, TV networks and licensed content distribution channels. This role will work closely with various stakeholders to help drive growth in HBO Max subscriptions and revenues across the global app platforms as well as pay-tv and broadband distributors. The Analyst will collaborate across the WarnerMedia organization to identify opportunities, report on business and industry trends, and help facilitate access to data and insights.

Primary Responsibilities

Works with the team and other WM stakeholders to develop analyses in support of HBO Max and other content distribution strategies by identifying emerging patterns in subscription and engagement behaviors.
Assists in building customer lifecycle and content valuation models, leveraging disparate data sources across multiple touchpoints and brands.
Upholds a ‘test and learn’ approach for new research initiatives by developing analytic plans to ensure accurate and robust results. Presents findings to key stakeholders along with strategic implications and recommendations.
Collaborates with various teams to align on data and methodologies. Develops dashboards in data visualization tools (e.g., Looker) to ensure that business reporting needs are met.
Takes on project management role in supporting the company’s data and analytics initiatives, including ongoing coordination across various teams.
Acts as a subject matter expert on consumer behavioral trends and competitive intelligence, translates to WM where applicable, and shares findings with internal stakeholders.
Cultivates and manages relationships with internal stakeholders. Facilitates the constant flow of information between teams critical to the day-to-day business.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required. Concentration in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Economics preferred.
2+ years of experience in an analytics role preferred.
Proficiency in working with large analytic datasets using SQL. Experience with visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
Analytical, numerate and motivated. Comfort with ambiguity and managing multiple projects simutaneously.
Expertise with Excel & PowerPoint. Experience using VBA and/or macros is a plus.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex methodologies and nuanced results into easy-to-understand insights using a storytelling approach.

The Perks

Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
Access to in-house learning and development resources
Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

title: Data Privacy Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
Req ID: 157777

NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Data Privacy Analyst to join our team in Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).

Data Privacy Analyst – Position Description

The person in this role will support and assist from an operational perspective the implementation of the Company’s global data protection and privacy framework, applicable policies and procedures, and the related governance operating model. Such person should possess a practical understanding of data privacy requirements associated with such a role. The individual performing such role must have the ability to engage with other business and technology teams in order to assist with the implementing of corporate data privacy practices and procedures. Strong preference for candidates with experience with the OneTrust data privacy application.

Such person will work closely and collaboratively with the Data Privacy Operational Lead. The person in this role needs to have a broad knowledge of the operational aspects of computer software and hardware. Must be able to convey technical language to other stakeholders often in non-technical terms. The person in such role must likewise be collaborative, inquisitive, and have strong organizational skills, the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision, and the ability to handle large volumes of work in a highly matrixed organization. Such individual must further possess an “ownership mentality,” but simultaneously thrive as part of a team.

Depending on the candidate’s skill and experience, responsibilities may eventually expand to cover more strategic and additional responsibilities. This position reports to the Data Privacy Operational Lead and is available immediately.

The duties of the position include but are not limited to the following:

Take the lead in managing the Company’s OneTrust Data Privacy tool by launching and tracking open assessments, running reports, responding to inquiries as to how the tool operates and be responsible for updating the data elements tied to assessments as needed.
Ability to understand the technical aspects of applications and systems in order to assist as needed with data privacy assessments.
Assist with developing and delivering training for responders to Data Privacy Assessments.
Perform the initial review all data privacy assessments for valid and completeness of responses.
Ability to implement new assessment templates within the OneTrust data privacy tool.
Assist with gathering information from various internal teams associated with personal data flows in order to facilitate development of processing activity data maps.
Support data subject request data gathering activities
Assist with updating schedules to the various group transfer agreements
Manage invoicing associated with data privacy matters in legal matter management system.

Requirements For The Position

College degree required with 1 to 3 years in the information technology industry preferred.
1 to 2 years data privacy experience preferred or demonstrated basic understanding of data privacy compliance.
Broad understanding of information technology services and technical aspects of applications
Ability to participate in multiple work streams in a resource-constrained environment.
Problem-solving skills, professionalism and integrity necessary in order to be privy to sensitive, confidential, complex data protection/privacy issues.
Ability to work collaboratively with members of the legal team, information security team, compliance team to advance the Privacy Program goals and objectives projects and initiatives.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills: ability to manage and prioritize many tasks to deliver timely, high-quality work.

Basic Minimum Requirements

College degree required
1 to 2 years data privacy experience or demonstrated basic understanding of data privacy compliance.

INDSALES

About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.

NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, disability, age, veteran-status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other class protected by law. To learn more, please visit https://us.nttdata.com/en/about-us/content/diversity-and-inclusion. Furthermore, NTT DATA Services will make accommodations for eligible applicants on a case-by-case basis. Please email EEOOfficer@nttdata.com for assistance.

title: Genomic Data Analyst
job_function: Information Technology, Quality Assurance, and Science
industries: Computer Software, Government Administration, and Public Policy Offices
description:
Kelly Government Solutions is a strategic supplier and business partner to the federal government and its key suppliers. Through our partnership with the National Institutes of Health, Kelly Government Solutions offers administrative, IT, engineering, scientific, and healthcare professionals the opportunity to work with the leading medical research center in the world. We are seeking a Data Analyst at the National Institutes of Health in Rockville, MD.







This is a long-term contract position which offers:

- Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit package

- Optional health, vision, and dental plans

- Vacation leave as well as 10 paid federal holidays and 401K plan.

- Access to NIH’s unparalleled resources and niche scientific initiatives







You should know: Vaccination against COVID-19 is a requirement for all job opportunities offered through Kelly Government Solutions, in accordance with the Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors.







TASKS/SERVICES. The contractor shall:

(1) Stay current on NIH policies related to genomic data sharing and participate on committees charged with the implementation of the policies

(2) Maintain databases and spreadsheets related to various programmatic data sharing activities

(3) Create and present data sharing training materials to program staff

(4) Maintain databases and spreadsheets for tracking and analyzing submission of datasets into the NIH’s Database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP)

(5) Provide support for all data sharing related activities; create and maintain tracking systems and prepare reports to be presented to senior program leadership

(6) Create and distribute newsletters and educational materials for outside investigators

(7) Design, develop and maintain databases, Listservs, spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations and other computer applications

(8) Work with staff on meeting and workshop planning

(9) Work with staff on conducting literature reviews, particularly providing scientific expertise in the area of genetic epidemiology and genomic data sharing

(10) Undertake special assignments requiring fact-finding research; compose reports for use by staff

(11) Provide guidance to program staff and investigators on collecting the information required for genomic data sharing consistent with NIH policy; participate in meetings and conference calls, and handle correspondence with program staff and investigators







REQUIREMENTS. The contractor must have:

(1) Bachelor’s degree in a related field or Master's degree in a related field

(2) Minimum of four (4) years of related experience

(3) Knowledge of Genetic Epidemiology or related research or data driven field (Genomics research, Bioinformatics)

(4) Excellent analytical, organizational and time management skills.

(5) Knowledge of project management, organizing and tracking data and performing analyses

(6) Strong communications skills, both oral and written







PLEASE APPLY ONLINE

When you apply, please know a Kelly Government Solutions Recruiter will review your resume and will contact you directly, if your skills and experience match the requirements of this position; a full job description can be made available at that time.




Due to the high volume of inquiries, we regret that we cannot accept phone calls. Even if you aren’t contacted for this position, you are still part of our talent network. All Kelly recruiters have access to your profile, which expands your opportunities even further.




As a specialty talent company, Kelly is committed to doing the right thing for our talent and clients. We stand up for equity, inclusion, fair treatment, and opportunity for all as these build the foundation of our Talent Promise. With a focus on safety, value, well-being, investment, and opportunity, Kelly’s Talent Promise confirms our commitment to those in search of a better way to work and live and to help discover what’s next.




It is obvious things are different than they were just a few months ago. Kelly is at the forefront of ensuring the safety of our employees in this new working environment. Be well and stay strong.

title: Statistical Programming Analyst II
industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Summary

Develops comprehensive reports and analyzes data in order to identify patterns and trends. Assists in creating materials that aid in illustrating analytical/data findings. Assists with sophisticated data interpretation, compilation, and verification to guide departmental efforts.

Description


40% Designs, codes, maintain and executes simple to complex database programs for the extraction and presentation of data for standard and ad hoc reporting. Utilizes statistical programming tools to identify patterns and trends in data. Assists in sampling design, sample selection, and relevant projections. Performs statistical validations of sampling and related projections. Assists with the preparation of charts, illustrations, other graphics and narrative reports to explain findings.
30% Assists with development of complex statistical analysis, including standard reporting, AD HOC reporting, and data mining tools. Assists with sophisticated data interpretation, compilation, and verification to guide departmental efforts.
20% Provides assistance in development of project plans and system life cycle maintenance, development of change requests and test plans impacting existing databases, and in the research of new sources for data.
10% Verifies data in existing databases and assists in the collection of data and management of existing databases. Creates supporting documentation outlining procedures within scope of responsibility.

Required Education

Bachelor's or Master's degree Statistics/Biostatistics, mathematics, computer science, or other job related field

Required Work Experience

Two years statistical programming or statistical interpretation

Preferred Work Experience

Two years of experience with statistical practices.
Two years relational database experience (May be concurrent)
Professional SAS and Tableau experience

Required Skills And Abilities

Good organizational, customer service, and analytical skills
Ability to use complex mathematical calculations
Demonstrated knowledge of mathematical or statistical concepts
Relevant computer programming skills

Preferred Skills And Abilities

Good oral and written communication skills
Computer systems support knowledge

Required Software And Tools

Microsoft Office

Preferred Software And Tools

SAS
Tableau
DB2

We participate in E-Verify and comply with the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

BlueCross BlueShield of South Carolina and our subsidiary companies maintain a continuing policy of nondiscrimination in employment to promote employment opportunities for persons regardless of age, race, color, national origin, sex, religion, veteran status, disability, weight, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other legally protected status. Additionally, as a federal contractor, the company maintains Affirmative Action programs to promote employment opportunities for minorities, females, disabled individuals and veterans. It is our policy to provide equal opportunities in all phases of the employment process and to comply with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations.

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail abilities@bcbssc.com or call 1-800-288-2227, ext. 43172 with the nature of your request. We will make a determination regarding your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

title: Data Quality Assurance Analyst
industries: Financial Services
description:
Join BSI Financial Services as a Data Quality Assurance Analyst.





The goal of the Data Quality Assurance team is to ensure newly loaded loans are accurately setup for servicing. Analysts work directly with the Loan boarding team to verify data against loan documents. The analyst will gain experience with multiple loan types and servicing files. In addition to reviewing documents, the analyst will also monitor illogical condition dashboards on BSI’s Analytics system called Asset360.





 





Position Type and Expected Hours of Work





This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m., overtime may be required





 





WHAT WILL YOU DO:                                                                                                                                          






Performs a data to doc comparison of new loans to ensure data accuracy


Provides quality assurance with direction and guidance necessary to maintain compliance


Works directly with the loan boarding team on new product setup and provides guidance to ensure loan products are setup accurately. 


Monitors illogical condition dashboards and implements corrective action on data integrity issues.


Acts as an extension of the Loan Boarding group to isolate data mapping issues prior to the loans being loaded to the BSI system







Responsible for meeting legal requirements and following internal policies






 





WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:






Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint & Word)


Must be able to read, comprehend, and act upon various forms of information received from internal and external sources.


An associate degree or higher or 2 years minimum related work experience preferred


Knowledge of different Mortgage Products: Fixed Rate/ARM/Balloon/Heloc/Option Arms, preferred


Ability to think analytically, understand the business products, and escalate problem areas.


Demonstrates ability to take initiative and follow through on projects


Collaborates effectively with inter-departmental teams to achieve organizational goals


Exhibits strong verbal and written communication skills,


Critical/Logistical thinking skills


Ability to multi-task & prioritize effectively and efficiently


Identify Issues and create resolutions quickly


Must be composed and professional under pressure, in fast paced work environment




EEO Statement



We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Analyst for Mass Spectrometry Proteomics
industries: Biotechnology Research, Hospitals and Health Care, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Program Description

The Cancer Research Technology Program (CRTP) develops and implements emerging technology, cancer biology expertise and research capabilities to accomplish NCI research objectives. The CRTP is an outward-facing, multi-disciplinary hub purposed to enable the external cancer research community and provides dedicated support to NCI's intramural Center for Cancer Research (CCR). The dedicated units provide expertise in electron microscopy, protein characterization, mass spectrometry, protein expression, optical microscopy, and genomics. These research efforts are an integral part of CCR at the Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research (FNLCR), where CRTP scientists work collaboratively with intramural NCI investigators to provide research technologies and expertise.

Key Roles/Responsibilities

Analyze data produced by a high throughput mass spectrometry proteomics laboratory
Interact productively and constructively with scientists performing mass spectrometry proteomics experiments
Produce detailed findings, figures, and presentations for discussion with mass spectrometry scientists
Comprehensive data analysis using variety of different methods and software, such as Proteome Discoverer, Spectronaut, Skyline, and etc.
Develop new proteomics and data analytical methods
Summarize and present key results at project reviews meetings and contribute and write manuscripts for per review publications

Basic Qualifications

To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:

Possession of Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university according to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) in biochemistry, analytical chemistry, or other related discipline or four (4) years relevant experience in lieu of degree. Foreign degrees must be evaluated for U.S. equivalency
In addition to the education requirement, a minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible experience
More than three years of MS-based data analysis experience in mass spectrometry proteomics
Solid understanding of programs used to analyze mass spectrometry proteomics data
Strong theoretical understanding of both global and targeted mass spectrometry proteomics and bioinformatic methods to interpret and validate findings
Experience using several of the listed MS software suites for proteomics workflow analysis, such as Xcalibur, free style, Proteome Discoverer, MSGF+, Spectronaut, Skyline, etc.
Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Preferred Qualifications

Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:

M.S. degree in biochemistry, analytical chemistry or other related discipline from an accredited college or university according to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation
2 years of related post graduate MS-based proteomic experience Data Analyst II
5-years for Data Analyst III
Experience with multivariate analysis techniques such as Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) and cluster analysis
Experience with programming languages or platforms such as Python, R, or Matlab
Experience analyzing global and/or targeted proteomic data
Experience with producing and interpreting proteomic graphical displays, such as heat maps and volcano plots

title: Quality Assurance Data Analyst (MN or remote within the U.S.)
industries: Medical Equipment, Hospitals and Health Care, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Open to remote within the United States with preference to Minnesota.

Careers that Change Lives

A career at Medtronic is like no other. We’re purposeful. We’re committed. And we’re driven by our Mission to alleviate pain, restore health and extend life for millions of people worldwide.

In this exciting role as a Quality Assurance Data Analyst, you will have responsibility to transform the way we look at outputs of our complaint, FCA and PHO processes. You will partner to develop innovative methods/techniques to proactively capture potential quality or compliance gaps for Customer Quality to act on. The candidate will provide analytics and insights that will help optimize quality performance and drive decision making to improve complaint, FCA and PHO outputs.

A Day in the Life

Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned:

Develops, inspects, mines, transforms, and models data to raise productivity, improve decision making, and gain competitive advantage.
Conducts statistical analysis on data and information to ensure correct predictive forecasting or classification.
Manages all aspects of end-to-end data processing utilizing customized report building functions of systems.
Maintains analytical systems, verifies the accuracy of the data, and acts as a liaison to the business.
Partners with Data Science and CQ Technology team members to explore and implement methodologies to understand performance.
Identifies and implements innovative techniques / methods to provide insight for improved quality and compliance
Travel requirement: less than 25%

Must Have: Minimum Requirements

Bachelor's degree with 2+ years of work experience in Quality or regulated industry OR Advanced degree with 0+ years of work experience in Quality or regulated industry.

Nice to Have

Knowledge of and direct experience working with signal processing and machine learning methodologies
Demonstrated ability to work within a team-based project environment
Experience with trending and analysis of complex data from multiple sources
Experience interacting with a multi-disciplinary, cross-functional team
Experience utilizing statistical methods to inform decision making
Experience working in a regulated industry
Quality focus, willingness to learn, versatility and adaptability

About Medtronic

Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

Physical Job Requirements

The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)

Additional Information

Posting Date: Oct 18, 2021
Travel: Yes, < 25 % of the Time

title: Data Analyst, Credit Risk
industries: Computer Software, Internet Publishing, and Financial Services
description:
We’re working on making the global financial system programmable. This is one of the largest opportunities for impact in the history of computing, on par with the rise of modern operating systems. Enabling the realization of this opportunity and simultaneously controlling our credit risk exposure, the Credit Risk team plays a critical role in the company’s financial health.

We’re looking for an experienced data analyst to partner with the Credit Risk team as well as our Merchant Intelligence team to drive the use of data to measure and limit our credit risk, ensure high-quality decisions, and point towards future opportunities. The ideal candidate has experience in credit risk data analysis, thinks creatively about measurement that leads to actionable outcomes, and values rigor in experimentation.

You Will

Work closely with the Credit Risk team to solve their most pressing challenges using data and insights
Focus on understanding the underlying needs of the Credit Risk team and working with them to design dashboards and metrics to address those needs
Use data to support the development of risk mitigation strategies and interventions while preserving and improving the user experience
Evolve our risk metrics, the datasets to support them, and the measurement of causal impact of initiatives to improve them
Effectively communicate the outcomes of your analysis to key stakeholders

You’d Ideally Have

3+ years experience in data analytics preferably related to credit risk
Degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering)
Experience and passion for metrics and dashboard visualizations
Highly skilled at writing SQL to query relational databases; knowledge of R or Python and prior experience with writing and debugging data pipelines using a distributed data framework (Hadoop/Spark/Pig/etc.) a plus
Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills

title: Pharmacy Data Analyst (Remote)
industries: Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

Pharmacy Data Analyst with experience utilizing Claims, Network, Rebate, and other supplemental Rx data sources. Designs and implements processes and solutions associated with a wide variety of data sets used for data/text mining, analysis, modeling, and predicting to enable informed business decisions. Gains insight into key business problems and deliverables by applying statistical analysis techniques to examine structured and unstructured data from multiple disparate sources. Collaborates across departments and with customers to define requirements and understand business problems. Uses advanced mathematical, statistical, querying, and reporting methods to develop solutions. Develops information tools, algorithms, dashboards, and queries to monitor and improve business performance. Creates solutions from initial concept to fully tested production, and communicates results to a broad range of audiences. Effectively uses current and emerging technologies.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Extracts and compiles various sources of information and large data sets from various systems to identify and analyze outliers.
Sets up process for monitoring, tracking, and trending department data.
Prepares any state mandated reports and analysis.
Works with internal, external and enterprise clients as needed to research, develop, and document new standard reports or processes.
Implements and uses the analytics software and systems to support the departments goals.
Flow charting.
Tableau visualizations.
Effort management: Facilitate meetings to gather requestor requirements, status updates, working with our support groups (EIM), and occasional client surveying.
UM Data Analysis to provide insights into PA review TAT, consistency of decision, and overall trending.
Pharmacy and medical claims analysis to identify trends in utilization.
Pharmacy and medical claims analysis to identify gaps in care.
Pharmacy and medical claims help manage drug spend and quality of care provided to members.
Documentation - BRDs, RRDs, SOP's.

Required Education

Job Qualifications

Associate's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Required Experience

1-3 years of clinical data and statistical analysis experience utilizing claims, network, rebate and other supplemental Rx data sources.
Must be able to read and write SQL queries.
Must have experience with visualization tools (e.g. Tableau and PowerBI).
Must be familiar with pharmacy data (e.g. pharmacy claims).
Excel experience (e.g. Pivot Tables, Graphs,Flow Charts, Advanced Formulas, Power Query, VLookup, etc...).

Preferred Education

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Preferred Experience

3-5 years of clinical data and statistical analysis experience.
Familiar with supplemental pharmacy data (e.g. Medispan).
SAS.

To all current Molina employees: If you are interested in applying for this position, please apply through the intranet job listing.

Molina Healthcare offers a competitive benefits and compensation package. Molina Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) M/F/D/V.

title: Bioinformatics Data Analyst
industries: Computer Software, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry, by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.

You will be on the front-lines developing responses to a variety of inquiries from our healthcare providers, collaborators, and patients. This position is responsible for compiling and analyzing data to respond to client inquiries.

What You’ll Do

Perform risk-based assessments of occurrences and urgent inquiries, drawing on molecular genetics and clinical testing experience to prioritize investigations while balancing customer needs against the team’s available resources
Aggregate and present data for root cause analysis and CAPAs as appropriate
Work closely with Lab Directors in collaboration with the Client Services, ClinConsult, and Medical teams to investigate and analyze issues and strive for utmost client satisfaction with the entire Invitae experience
Explore data to assess continuous process improvements following resolution of escalated inquiries in order to enhance internal processes and client satisfaction
Provide clear, concise written and oral communication including of technical findings to non-technical teammates
When laboratory issues are identified as a result of client inquiries, initiate incident reports and ensure appropriate documentation.

What You’ll Bring

Expert in Python data management and problem solving
Strong knowledge of querying databases: SQL, datalog, etc.
Knowledge of human molecular genetics and experience in a clinical testing laboratory
Understanding of NGS results, data analysis, and variant interpretation
Ability to understand customers’ questions and translate to an actionable analysis plan
Excellent trouble-shooting skills: Ability to successfully analyze problems and propose solutions to the medical escalation investigation leadership.
Experience working within a knowledge management and documentation management environment
Preference for industry experience in healthcare, biotech, and/or life sciences. Bonus: Familiarity and/or hands-on experience with DNA/RNA extraction and next-generation sequencing (NGS) wet lab protocols, preferably in a production setting.
Preferred PhD, MS or equivalent experience

At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Biotechnology Research, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Job Title: Associate (entry level) Data Analyst – Remote (JP9432)

Location: Thousand Oaks, CA. (100% REMOTE)

Employment Type: Contract

Business Unit: Commercial Discounts

Duration: 5+ months (with likely extensions and/or conversion to permanent)

Posting Date: 11/16/2021

Rate: $20-25/hr

3 Key Consulting is hiring an Associate Managed Care Contract Compliance for a consulting engagement with our direct client, a leading global biopharmaceutical company.

Job Description

The successful candidate for this data-focused position will be responsible for ensuring Contract Compliance by cross-checking Managed Care Rebate Invoice submissions against Formulary Validation results and proactively identifying claims for dispute. Additionally, you will work in concert and at the direction of your direct supervisor to coordinate your work with theirs to ensure payments are made accurately and timely. This role will require you to work cross-functionally with partners from Payor Contracting and Market Access and will require active participation in regular status meetings, for which you will be responsible for taking and distributing meeting minutes. Additionally, you will be responsible for maintaining dispute status tracker as well as other tasks as assigned.

Why is the Position Open?

Needing additional cover; special project.

Top Must Have Skills

Must have 1-2 years' experience working with large data sets.
Basic understanding of prescription drug coverage.
Intermediate Excel skills, and tech savvy.
Great communicational skills.

Basic Qualifications

B.S. degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Sciences or related discipline.
Min 1-2 years' experience working with large data sets.
Basic understanding of prescription drug coverage.
Intermediate Excel skills

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Managed Care, PBMs, or other payors, and in depth understanding of prescription drug coverage in the US.
Advanced MS Excel skills
Demonstrate independence and ability to produce quality results while meeting tight deadlines under minimal direction
Generate complete, accurate, and concise documentation.
High energy individual who can multi-task and handle a fast-pace, dynamic work environment
Take detailed meeting minutes
Actively participate in cross-functional meetings which will require effective communication across various levels of the organization
Perform analysis on data sets
Maintain dispute status tracker
Work in partnership with direct supervisor to ensure smooth handoffs of work.

Employee Value Proposition

Great team dynamic
Collaborative team
Opportunity to growth and learn new skill sets
Facetime with leadership and management

Red Flags

No excel experience; must have strong experience in Excel (more than basic skills), formula driven
Not driven or willing to learn new things
Must be able to multitask

Interview Process

Video Skype Panel Interview

We invite qualified candidates to send your resume to resumes@3keyconsulting.com. If you decide that you’re not interested in pursuing this particular position, please feel free to take a look at the other positions on our website www.3keyconsulting.com/careers. You are also welcome to share this opportunity with anyone you think might be interested in applying for this role.

Regards,

3KC Talent Acquisition Team

title: Quality Assurance Data Analyst
description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Quality Assurance Data Analyst to join us to ensure we build a quality product as we continue to grow our predictive analytics business. As a Quality Assurance Data Analyst, you will get to:




Interpret, build upon, and comply with company quality assurance standards. Carefully maintain complaint and nonconformance processing through records and tracking systems, including root cause and corrective actions
Develop new standards for production and design, with improvements as needed, and create testing protocols for implementation across all service lines
Collaborate with the Benchmark Research Team members across the organization that focus on improving product data quality, data pipeline efficiency and data platform performance




If you are interested in the intersection of public sector operations, research and data analytics, we believe this is an unprecedented opportunity to experience it first-hand.




Responsibilities:

Working with leadership and peers to:

Ensure data and analytics engineering team delivers a high quality, scalable and maintainable product.
Manage code change in a robust, secure manner.
Plan, execute, and oversee the testing of incoming and outgoing data to confirm accuracy and conformance to specifications.
Track, document, and report quality levels.
Develop or update company complaint and inspection procedures to ensure documentation, inspection, and resolution of complaints.
Analyze and investigate product complaints/issues to ensure closure in accordance with company requirements.
Provide training and support to quality assurance team on systems, policies, procedures, and core processes.
Facilitate product ownership and scrum activates
Partner with cross-functional team members to collect and document detailed product requirements.
Build in-depth product knowledge to identify product improvement opportunities through agile scrum activities




Requirements:

The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally organized, methodical professional with the experience necessary to take our products to the next level with respect to accuracy, security, and safety. You will be charged with developing a complete QA program that not only safeguards the quality of our products, but also fosters a “quality culture”, in which all employees become actively engaged in guaranteeing quality in both production and the finished product.

Bachelor’s degree
Professional certification, such as Six Sigma, Quality Engineer, or Quality Auditor

Who You Are:

Superb computer competence, including database management
Knowledge of quality assurance terminology, methods, and tools
Analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
Demonstrated knowledge of testing best practices, version control practices and defect management practice
Understanding of Agile/Scrum methodology and how QA functions within it
Works and communicates well with others:
Has empathy for colleagues and customers
Able to receive and respond positively to feedback
Able to work independently with reasonable guidance from management (except in complex and non-routine situations)
Able to effectively communicate across multiple levels (team members, managers) in a fast-paced environment




Who We Are:

Founded by a group of seasoned entrepreneurs, Benchmark Analytics is a SaaS technology startup housed in the Ravenswood technology corridor on Chicago’s Northside. In partnership with the University of Chicago (who is part owner of our company), we are building a predictive analytics platform for law enforcement human capital management. Our series of predictive tools help police departments support officers along a wellness continuum and provides individualized, research-based interventions and supports.




We are a double-bottom line company – our management team is comprised of former police officers, former city officials, and current change makers who believe in (and have witnessed) the power of data to transform government….and in this case, improve policing. If you are interested in the intersection of public sector operations, research and data analytics, and building amazing software we believe this is an unprecedented opportunity to experience it first-hand. We’re an agile, fast-growing company and you’ll get to do much more as the company grows.




What We Offer:

A truly unique experience to work for a fast-growing company with a purpose
The satisfaction that comes with being part of a solution that is making a difference within the institution of policing and law enforcement
The excitement that comes with the need to endlessly innovate and transform our market
We cover 75% of Medical (BCBS) Premiums, Dental & Vision Premiums, and offer 100% company sponsored Life Insurance as well as a 401k plan
Unlimited PTO




The Fine Print and How to Apply:

Thank you for your interest in our company and what we are building!

Benchmark Analytics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all kinds in our effort to create a stellar workforce of committed and passionate team members.
Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor employment visas at this time, so we can only accept applications from candidates who are authorized to work in the US.
If you’d like to apply, please email your resume to nick.montgomery@benchmarkanalytics.com.
