title: Data Privacy Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
Req ID: 157777

NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Data Privacy Analyst to join our team in Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).

Data Privacy Analyst – Position Description

The person in this role will support and assist from an operational perspective the implementation of the Company’s global data protection and privacy framework, applicable policies and procedures, and the related governance operating model. Such person should possess a practical understanding of data privacy requirements associated with such a role. The individual performing such role must have the ability to engage with other business and technology teams in order to assist with the implementing of corporate data privacy practices and procedures. Strong preference for candidates with experience with the OneTrust data privacy application.

Such person will work closely and collaboratively with the Data Privacy Operational Lead. The person in this role needs to have a broad knowledge of the operational aspects of computer software and hardware. Must be able to convey technical language to other stakeholders often in non-technical terms. The person in such role must likewise be collaborative, inquisitive, and have strong organizational skills, the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision, and the ability to handle large volumes of work in a highly matrixed organization. Such individual must further possess an “ownership mentality,” but simultaneously thrive as part of a team.

Depending on the candidate’s skill and experience, responsibilities may eventually expand to cover more strategic and additional responsibilities. This position reports to the Data Privacy Operational Lead and is available immediately.

The duties of the position include but are not limited to the following:

Take the lead in managing the Company’s OneTrust Data Privacy tool by launching and tracking open assessments, running reports, responding to inquiries as to how the tool operates and be responsible for updating the data elements tied to assessments as needed.
Ability to understand the technical aspects of applications and systems in order to assist as needed with data privacy assessments.
Assist with developing and delivering training for responders to Data Privacy Assessments.
Perform the initial review all data privacy assessments for valid and completeness of responses.
Ability to implement new assessment templates within the OneTrust data privacy tool.
Assist with gathering information from various internal teams associated with personal data flows in order to facilitate development of processing activity data maps.
Support data subject request data gathering activities
Assist with updating schedules to the various group transfer agreements
Manage invoicing associated with data privacy matters in legal matter management system.

Requirements For The Position

College degree required with 1 to 3 years in the information technology industry preferred.
1 to 2 years data privacy experience preferred or demonstrated basic understanding of data privacy compliance.
Broad understanding of information technology services and technical aspects of applications
Ability to participate in multiple work streams in a resource-constrained environment.
Problem-solving skills, professionalism and integrity necessary in order to be privy to sensitive, confidential, complex data protection/privacy issues.
Ability to work collaboratively with members of the legal team, information security team, compliance team to advance the Privacy Program goals and objectives projects and initiatives.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills: ability to manage and prioritize many tasks to deliver timely, high-quality work.

Basic Minimum Requirements

College degree required
1 to 2 years data privacy experience or demonstrated basic understanding of data privacy compliance.

INDSALES

About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.

NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, disability, age, veteran-status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other class protected by law. To learn more, please visit https://us.nttdata.com/en/about-us/content/diversity-and-inclusion. Advance Data Analytics and Services (ADA) Team is a group within Risk Modeling and Analytics (RMA) Organization, responsible for developing libraries, models, and applications centered around the in-house big data platform. title: Data Annotation Analyst
industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Help us grow into an ever-evolving marketplace. Seeking a reliable and organized Data Annotation Analyst!

What We Do

Betterview, a San Francisco and San Diego-based company building insight through aerial imagery and machine learning, is looking for a [Job Title] to help tell the world about its industry-leading Enterprise SaaS platform.

Every day, our team is focused on the needs of our customers. We strive to earn their trust by providing valuable, accurate insight that is important to their businesses. We provide our customers with information that is not only useful to their business decisions but is easy to use. We combine high quality human interactions with sleek, intuitive design and are pioneers on the journey alongside our customers, who are transforming the way they do business with data-driven decision-making.

THE OPPORTUNITYBetterview’s Machine Vision team maintains an ever-expanding suite of computer vision models to detect property conditions and identify risk factors using aerial imagery. A model is only as good as the data it’s trained on, and that’s why we’re looking for a reliable and organized Data Annotation Analyst to help curate and expand our library of training data.

Reporting to the Data Annotation Manager, the Data Annotation Analyst will support Betterview’s data labeling operations that enable us to continually expand and enrich our training datasets. For example, if Betterview were looking for more imagery containing solar panels on a roof, the Data Annotation team supports these efforts by creating a dataset in which every image in the dataset contains a clean example of solar panels. Typically this will entail reviewing/cleaning data, preparing it for outside labeling.

What You Will Be Doing

Supporting data labeling projects both internally and in coordination with vendors to support Betterview’s machine vision roadmap
Reviewing imagery to:
Measure annotation quality (QA)
Find and rectify mislabeled imagery (data curation)
Uncover model weaknesses that can be addressed with more data (model improvement)
Processing and transforming imagery and labels to ingest it into machine learning workflows
Contributing to continual improvement of data labeling pipeline with Data Annotation Manager
Creating and maintaining modular library of data labeling instructions for all supported classes, and expand as needed to support expansion of Betterview’s product suite
Cultivating deep knowledge of Betterview’s machine vision data and leverage it to mine suitable candidates for data labeling at a large scale
Identifying opportunities for improvement of methods and processes to ensure data quality and consistency
Identifying opportunities for improvement in Betterview’s data and, together with machine vision colleagues, working to implement solutions
Creating and maintaining internal reports to track quality and size of training datasets over time
Updating tasks in Jira and keep good notes


What You Will Bring To Our Company

Experienced in SQL at the level of an analyst
Mastery of Google Enterprise Suite (Docs, Drive, Sheets)
Excellent organization and project management skills
Strong attention to detail and data hygiene habits


The successful candidate:

Has an analytical mind and a strong nose for data issues
Has strong initiative, accountability, and is a self starter
Has an interest in data science, machine learning and/or computer vision
Has some familiarity with Python/Jupyter Notebooks a plus


What We Provide

Compensation commensurate with experience.
Generous health benefits – medical, dental and vision.
Medical offerings include PPO, HMO, and HDHP options through Kaiser and Blue Shield.
Betterview covers 75% of the sponsored medical plan employee premium, 60% of dependents.
For dental and vision, Betterview covers 75% of the employee premium, 50% of dependents.
401(k) Retirement Plan.
Betterview matches 100% of employee contributions up to the first 3% of pay, then 50% of employee contributions on the next 2% of pay.
FSA and HSA.
10 paid holidays.
Full-time employees receive 160 hours per year of paid time off; part-time employees accrue PTO on a pro-rated basis.
Charity contribution match, up to $100.
Cell phone reimbursement.
Professional development reimbursement.
Commuter benefits.


COVID Vaccine is required as a condition of employment with Betterview. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.

Betterview provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetics, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. In addition to federal law requirements, Betterview complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Betterview will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

Betterview will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law. If you’re applying for a position in San Francisco, review the guidelines applicable in your area.

Betterview expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Betterview employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to complete this application, please let us know by contacting HR(at)Betterview(dot)com.

title: Legal Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Financial Services
description:
Thinking about an alternative legal career? Bloomberg Law offers an opportunity to advance and develop your legal career through a distinctive, non-traditional path. This role allows you to blend your passion for the law with technology, business, and data analysis. Bloomberg Law is dependent upon our legal data analysts to use their legal domain knowledge, critical thinking and strategic approach to build excellent products.

As a member of the Legal Data Analysis team, you will align closely with both our business and engineering teams to help drive product development and ensure data accuracy in Bloomberg Law"s initiatives. We apply our robust legal domain knowledge, project management skills and sharp attention to detail to annotate, analyze and evaluate legal datasets including court opinions, court briefs and contractual provisions. The team's work is critical in supporting feature developments that use artificial intelligence and machine learning including Points of Law, Brief Analyzer and Draft Analyzer. This role will give the opportunity to display your enthusiasm, problem-solving and organizational skills, ability to collaborate, and flexibility in pivoting between projects in a fast-paced environment. This position can be located in either New York or Princeton NJ.

What's in it for you:

Contribute to the Bloomberg Law platform by supporting the development of new technology-driven solutions for the legal professionals.
You"ll belong to a team responsible for management of data tagging and evaluation of model outputs as well as user acceptance testing, vendor management, and quality assurance, among other things.
You"ll build relationships through Bloomberg's dynamic and collaborative environment where you will work with engineering, among others, to ensure proper understanding of an attorney"s workflow and validate product builds.
We"ll invest in you, and coupled with our individualized approach to career development, we will help you expand your skills and opportunities.

You"ll need to have:

Graduated with a Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school.
Passed a state Bar examination and been admitted.
Minimum of 1-3 years relevant practice experience.
Familiarity with online legal research tools. Experience with the BLAW product is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including sophisticated concepts effectively.
Strong project management, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Self-starter and the ability to work with a high-degree of autonomy.
Interest in technology and development of technical skills.
Legal authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship now and in the future.

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Bloomberg is committed to diversity. It drives our innovation. At Bloomberg, you'll have the opportunity to go above and beyond and to take risks. You'll be a part of an organization that is entering new markets, launching new ventures, and pushing boundaries. Our ever-expanding array of technology, data, news, and media services champions innovation and empowers clients -- and offers nearly limitless opportunities for career growth.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We bring out the best in each other.

title: Researcher & Data Analyst, Fine Arts
industries: Artists and Writers, Beverage Manufacturing, and Luxury Goods and Jewelry
description:
About Sotheby's

Established in 1744, Sotheby’s is the world’s premier destination for art and luxury. Synonymous with innovation, Sotheby’s promotes access, connoisseurship and preservation of fine art and rare objects through auctions, private sales and retail locations. Our trusted global marketplace is supported by a network of specialists spanning 40 countries and 50 categories, which include Contemporary Art, Modern and Impressionist Art, Old Masters, Chinese Works of Art, Jewelry, Watches, Wine and Spirits, and Interiors, among many others.

THE ROLE

Working as part of a centralized Research Team in the heart of Sotheby’s Technology and Product Group under the Data division, reporting to the London Data Transformation Manager. This individual will be responsible for the data reformatting and consolidation of intelligence on the property database. It is their responsibility to ensure the highest standard of data quality and data integrity at all time.

Responsibilities

Working mainly on internal data, you will be meticulous and accurate in the reformatting of the necessary information.
Clean and centralize internal systems data on Excel:
Reformat and standardize the requested amount of data every day
Follow internal guidelines thoroughly
Monitor your own work, meet targets and regularly report to senior researcher
Communicate any questions or tips to the team to always improve guidelines
Other tasks will involve:
Gathering intelligence from external sources for specific artist projects
Researching the full market history and current ownerships of works of art
Entering new intelligence to expand the database
Data maintenance & updates

Ideal Experience & Competencies

Exceptional Excel proficiency: you can demonstrate strong Excel knowledge and skills
Prior data analyst experience strongly preferred
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
Proficiency with MS, Outlook, Slack, Google tools and general familiarity with database management (knowledge of Sotheby’s systems is a plus)
Flexibility to work long hours, including evenings, weekends and deadline periods
Ability to work under high pressure, perform multiple tasks simultaneously and meet targets
Ability to troubleshoot and solve problematic situations on a regular basis
Discreet, dependable and mature
Enthusiasm about art and willingness to broaden knowledge

title: Data Quality Analyst
industries: Research Services, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Job ID:25911

Location:10 Brookline Place West, Brookline, MA 02445

Category:Clinical Research

Employment Type:Full time

Work Location:Full Remote: 4-5 days remote/wk

Overview

Located in Boston and the surrounding communities, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute brings together world renowned clinicians, innovative researchers and dedicated professionals, allies in the common mission of conquering cancer, HIV/AIDS and related diseases. Combining extremely talented people with the best technologies in a genuinely positive environment, we provide compassionate and comprehensive care to patients of all ages; we conduct research that advances treatment; we educate tomorrow's physician/researchers; we reach out to underserved members of our community; and we work with amazing partners, including other Harvard Medical School-affiliated hospitals.

The Office of Data Quality (ODQ) provides research support to the Dana-Farber/Harvard Cancer Center with a focus on quality assurance, quality control, and process improvement. Functions of ODQ include protocol subject registration and randomization, clinical research auditing, data and safety monitoring, quality control of DF/HCC initiated clinical trial data, national protocol and investigator registrations, DF/HCC multi-center coordination oversight, participation in general clinical trials education, and committee management. The Data Quality Manager supervises all Data Quality Analysts. The Data Quality Manager reports to the Director of ODQ.

The Data Quality Analysts work closely with investigators, research teams, and biostatisticians to ensure the integrity and quality of clinical trial data. Data Quality Analysts monitor the timely submission and completeness of clinical trial data entry, perform edit checks on the data, issue and resolve data queries, and perform other quality control and data cleanup tasks.

Requirements
Ensures clinical trial data collected throughout the conduct of a protocol are complete and accurate.
Using InForm EDC, reviews data captured on electronic case report forms to verify completion per protocol requirements.
Reviews program-generated queries and responses, reissues queries as appropriate, and closes queries upon resolution.
Generates query reports for distribution to study teams.
Performs logical edit checks on the data and reviews trends in the data to identify potential errors. Manually issues queries in response.
Performs other related quality control tasks to identify discrepancies and violations. Reports findings to investigators or ODQ leadership as appropriate.
Manages the collection and entry of clinical trial data on paper case report forms.
Collects completed case report forms from research teams.
Performs quality control activities on the collected data, requests clarifications as appropriate.
Enters data from paper case report forms into electronic systems.
Monitors completeness and timeliness of clinical trial data entry.
Generates monthly/quarterly missing data reports for distribution to research teams.
Reviews missing data reports for significant non-compliance and notifies investigators or ODQ leadership as appropriate.
Generates data reports for review by DF/HCC oversight committees (e.g., DSMB, DSMC)
Acts as a resource for investigators and study teams for items related to clinical trial data
Communicates directly with investigators and research teams regarding discrepancies and data entry processes.
Provides superior customer service when handling research team requests and responding to questions.
Guides research teams and investigators by encouraging best practices and assisting in the education of study team members on protocol-specific data entry requirements.
Coordinates with research teams to prepare data for analysis and/or study completion.
Verifies the accuracy and completeness of information within various systems that support clinical trial operations
Reviews critical data fields in the OnCore Clinical Trials Management System to ensure accuracy and consistency with institutional and departmental policies
Performs quality control activities on data present in various systems to identify errors or discrepancies
Generates reports from various systems for comparison and to aid in the conduct of quality control processes

Qualifications

Bachelors of Science/Arts required, with 2 years of relevant work/research experience.
Prior experience working in a medical or scientific research setting or comparable data-oriented role is required.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements and best practices related to the conduct of human subject research (e.g., FDA regulations, ICH GCP) is preferred.
Experience with electronic data capture systems and electronic case report forms (InForm preferred).
Knowledge and/or experience in data management or quality control is a plus.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with written and verbal English.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

Complex problem solving skills.
An ability to work independently.
Knowledge of clinical trial regulations and procedures, data management processes and database-related technical skills.
In addition to the above, has progressed to performing more advanced quality control processes.
Has a strong understanding of data management processes, and is able to resolve complex issues and questions independently.
Able to provide input on overall data quality planning, procedures, and systems with an eye towards consistent improvement.
Able to handle some projects independently, and work with Senior Data Analysts and/or the Data Quality Manager on larger projects.

Dana-Farber Cancer Institute is an equal opportunity employer and affirms the right of every qualified applicant to receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, age, ancestry, military service, protected veteran status, or other groups as protected by law.

title: Metadata Analyst - Bloomberg Data Dictionary
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Financial Services
description:
Data has become a central component of all financial services businesses. Bloomberg plays a significant role by delivering normalized data to thousands of our clients.

Bloomberg Data Dictionary Team:

Metadata is the key to using the data. It helps our clients discover and use Bloomberg data products.

We are in the midst of taking our metadata models to the next level using graph technologies. The goal is to improve existing models so that clients and internal applications can easily find and ingest Bloomberg data, which in turn increases our revenues.

The Role:

This role is central to building Unified Metadata Model (UMM). The UMM will form the basis of all field metadata across Bloomberg. The metadata analyst will work with large structured data models and data sets to tackle sophisticated business demands. The analyst will help build and maintain the integrity of UMM by working with Engineering, Global Data and Product organizations.

In this exciting role we expect you to understand existing and new data content, and map it to appropriate metadata. You will identify all issues, and implement methods/processes to improve them.

The metadata analyst will have a high level of business, communication, and organization skills, so that they can work optimally with multiple internal partners and external clients.. You will present the output of your metadata models to business users (both non-technical and technical).

What"s in it for you:

Fast growing business area
Broad scope to understand and specify metamodel for a leading company
Use new technologies including Semantic Models and Knowledge Graphs

We"ll trust you to:

Understand client use cases for Bloomberg data and develop new data models for financial data
Work with internal stakeholders to add and update metadata
Evaluate the verity of metadata, and ensure that clients can use it in conjunction with data
Take ownership for correcting issues with current metadata

You need to have:

3+ years of work experience, preferably at a financial services firm, fintech or a data provider
Solid grasp of financial data
Professional experience in data or metadata modelling
An interest to learn about new technologies including RDF and Linked Data
Bachelor degree in finance, business, data analytics or economics

We"d love to see:

Python programming experience
An understanding of or prior exposure to Bloomberg data

If this sounds like you, apply! We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this information about the team:

https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/solution/data-and-content

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Privacy Analyst
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Manufacturing, and Financial Services
description:
Plexus is a Network Marketing company and our mission is to enhance the health and happiness of those who support, promote, and use Plexus products. Plexus is passionate about doing it the way it could be done and should be done but rarely is.

Plexus is seeking outstanding individuals, who like working in a collaborative environment, getting the job done right, and empowering others. Plexus was recognized as one of Arizona’s Best Places to Work in 2016 and 2017. We were also ranked No. 1 on the 2015 and 2017 Arizona Corporate Excellence (ACE) Fastest-Growing Private Companies list.

The Data Privacy Analyst will report to the Director, Data Privacy and work closely with the Information Security team/Cybersecurity team, Compliance, Legal, and act as a Data Privacy liaison to all departments within our organization.

The Data Privacy Analyst will analyze, prioritize and convert information into knowledge as part of a modified privacy operational lifecycle. The analyst will analyze data, understand, protect, sustain and respond to governance and oversight of Data Protection business processes under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and other laws where required. As such, the Data Privacy Analyst will, in accordance with defined responsibilities and processes, advise on and monitor data privacy compliance, advise on Data Protection Impact Assessments, provide input to security incidents handling and cooperate with and act as the point of contact for regulators and third parties.

Job Duties
Co-ordinate data privacy requests, liaising with business areas, Information Security, Information Technology, and Records Management.
Performs special projects and other duties as may be assigned. Assists in leading special projects and duties as directed by the Director, Data Privacy.
Assist with data privacy activities and processes including 3rd party vendor privacy due diligence reviews, Data Protection Impact Assessments and recording of processing activities.
Assist with affecting change beyond the Data Privacy Impact Assessment including controls that are put in place which ensure the data inventory is updated.
Actively establish and maintain required processes for the Data Protection Office.
Assist in driving data privacy risk management and improvement, including providing oversight of data privacy controls and testing the effectiveness of implemented controls where appropriate.
Work with stakeholders on data privacy law, compliance and risks as required (for example by providing input on any changes to scope in controls or processes required as a result of new local laws).
Assist with the handling of individual rights requests.
Provide data privacy support for global information systems.
Assist in managing responses to requests from regulators, inspectors, and auditors, and data subjects.
Assist in developing training plan for the business and in developing and presenting tailored training for high-risk business areas.
Compile statistics and reports in support of metrics identified by the Director of Information Security / Data Privacy.
Communicating and prioritizing data privacy risks, able to confidently express data privacy concepts effectively to diverse audiences within the business.
Knowledge and understanding of US data privacy laws and practices.
Experience with IT security requirements, privacy and security risk assessments and best practices.
Data classification, Data mapping.
Project management experience.
Able to analyze and support the implementation of privacy laws, regulations, and best practices.
Provide analytical support to the Director of Data Privacy and act as a liaison to reporting departments.
Development and implementation of privacy policies, standards and procedures for employees.
Commit to working together as one team, exceed service expectations by developing positive relationships and treat others with value and respect…always.
Exhibit an honest and committed effort to delivering as promised, never compromising quality.
Achieve individual and team goals. Meet deadlines with the resources provided and never compromise ethical standards.
Seek opportunities for personal and professional development. Attend all company required training and actively participate in development conversations with managers.
Contribute to the overall growth and success of Plexus by embracing the Plexus core values:
We are One Plexus.
We are accountable.
We get the job done right.
We empower others.

Minimum Qualifications

High School Diploma
3+ years
Vendor Certifications

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree
5+ years
CIPP within 90 days

Benefits

100% company paid medical, dental and vision for Employees.
401k program with a company match and immediate vesting.
Quarterly bonuses based on company profitability.
Weekly drawings for gift cards and cash.

Thank you for taking the time to apply for an opportunity with our One Plexus team! If you had any issues during the application process, please contact us directly.

title: Specialist GIS Data Analyst
industries: Construction, Oil and Gas, and Financial Services
description:
About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success.

About The Role

The Specialist GIS Data Analyst will be responsible for the integrity and governance of Legacy Assets geospatial data, the maintenance and enhancement of various geospatial data models, and the creation and maintenance of end products including webmaps, apps, and dashboards.

Main Functions

Support integration of data platforms and solutions to provide secure, reliable, user-friendly interfaces and solutions that promote knowledge sharing and inform technical decision-making across the Asset.
Embed technical geospatial data governance and design principals that align high quality data collection and management with priority business risk controls and knowledge requirements.
Provide concise data reports and clear data visualizations for operators, technical resources and management
Experience with geospatial data across multiple technical data platforms including Esri ArcGIS platforms.
Ability to accurately QC geospatial data including correct positioning. Knowledge of coordinate reference systems and transformations and how to apply them to geospatial data.
Ability to create meaningful maps to effective communicate with users.

Requirements

About You

Bachelor’s Degree in Geography or GIS Science, Computer Science, Information Systems or related disciplines.
High level competency in Esri ArcGIS platform.
Experience with geodesy and manipulating coordinates.
FME experience.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce

The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance based bonuses and unique BHP employee share program.

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, people with disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.

We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.

BHP is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disability.

title: Jr. Data/Cyber security Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Job Title: Jr. Data/Cyber security Analyst

Location: ONSITE in Wilmington, DE

Duration: 6 Months C2H

Our client is an industry leader in precious metals, trading and exchange. They are seeking a Jr Data Security Analyst to work directly with the CFO/CIO to create a secure and compliant IT organization. This Jr Data Security Analyst will work to protect the organization’s computer systems and networks in compliance with the policies set forth by the company and vendor partners.

Jr. Data Security Analyst Duties and Responsibilities

Install and maintain Data Protection Software
Responsible for installing and uninstalling various security programs to protect sensitive data using firewalls and data-encryption technology
update on a regular basis to remove bugs and add new features
Perform audits to ensure a secure environment
Complete vendor questionnaires to remain compliant
Assess vendor risk by assisting in vendor risk analysis
Performing security audits, risk assessments and analysis
Making recommendations for enhancing data systems security
Researching attempted breaches of data security and rectifying security weaknesses
Formulating security policies and procedures
Perform business continuity tasks
Maintain policies and procedure that pertain to risk assessment
Provide weekly updates based on level of importance
Assist in penetration testing to expose areas of weakness and potential attacks
Provide proactive updates on active risks and vulnerabilities
Create and maintain ongoing documentation
Participate in the creating of a security plan to reduce risk and exposure
Work with leadership to create future policy, procedures and standards
Provide triage support on related issues

Qualifications:

Associates Degree in Cyber Security, Information Security or related required. Bachelor’s Degree in aforementioned degrees preferred but not required
1-3 years of Cyber Security or Data Security experience (internships/work study/ coursework included)
Possess strong oral and written communication, analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent judgment and self-motivation.
Keep abreast of industry security trends and developments, as well as applicable government regulations.
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or other data security or cyber security certifications
Nice to have: previous knowledge of basic accounting principles
Experience with any of the following tools: Tenable10, Nessus, ManageEngine (or other Event Log Analyzer)

title: Entry Level - Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Motor Vehicle Manufacturing
description:
About GM

Job Description

There's never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including openwork spacesand virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteerinterests, andmake it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

General Motorshasan exciting opportunity forrecentcollege graduateswho are technical, innovative, problem solverstoapply toour Analytics Career Evolution (ACE)development program.

Employees hired intothe ACE program willhave an opportunity toacceleratetheirprofessionalexperienceand expand their networkbyworkingacross severalareas of GMfor the firstfewyearsoftheiremployment.The ACE development program will provide a vast number ofexciting projects, visibility to senior leadership, robusttraining,and networking opportunities.

At the end of thedevelopmentprogram,ACEemployees willhave an opportunity to work withACEprogram leaders and human resources to find their next role within general motors.In anticipation of these opportunities becoming available, if you are interested in learning more about GM, completing this profile will allow us to stay connected.

If you share our passion for reimagining transportation and creating a safer,betterand more sustainable future, we encourage you to apply today!

Weare Looking For DataAnalystprofessionals Who

Have a steadfast drive for excellence
Challenge themselves and their peers
Enjoy working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Demonstrate a good work ethic
Have a strong ability and willingness to learn
Exhibit curiosity and are willing to explore new possibilities and solutions
Desire to deliver innovative solutions to complex problems
Understand advanced math and analytics concepts, andcanapply them to real applications

Role-as aDataAnalyst,theysupport operational improvement and business decision making through ad-hoc statistical analysis of curated enterprise data and self-constructed data sets. Data Analysts collaborate closely with business leaders, IT partners, and other analysts to develop new and unique data-driven solutions using Big Data platforms, creative analytical methods, and data visualization techniques.

Requirements

Additional Job Description

Education:Bachelor's degree inMathematics,Statistics,Computer Science,Economics, Social Science,or other quantitative degree preferred
Preferred academic or work experience in a data-intensive field/industry such as biotechnology, computational chemistry, cognitive or neurosciences, behavioral economics, econometrics, engineering, physics, quantitative finance, high frequency trading or intelligence analytics
Job locations will be in Warren or Detroit, Michigan; some roles will consider remote work
Technical Experience(orexposure to):

Big data tools such as Hadoop, Greenplum, Spark, Hue, and Knime
Business intelligence anddata visualizationtools including PowerBI, Excel, and Cognos.
Proficiency in one of the following programming languagesis desired:Python,R,Postgres, and HQL/SQL
Knowledgeable of statistical methods such as regression, probability analysis, risk analysis, statistical process control, and clustering is desired

This Role Offers The FollowingWork Appropriatelystrategies

Remote: The selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.
Hybrid:This position does not require an employee to be onsite full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.

Relocation assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements.

PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU DO NOT NEED SPONSORSHIP TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. WE ARE UNABLE TO CONSIDER CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE SPONSORSHIP.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:

Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statements

The policy of General Motors is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, General Motors is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us atCareers.Accommodations@GM.com. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

title: Data Analyst, Entry-Level
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet Publishing
description:
About The Team

At DoorDash, we’re building the future of on-demand delivery. Our world-class team of Data Scientists is passionate about creating opportunities for others to become the next generation of data-driven decision-makers at DoorDash. Many of our best Data Scientists had no experience prior to transferring into the role. This is an excellent opportunity to jumpstart your Analytics career.

About The Role

Our goal is to develop our entry-level Data Analysts into thoughtful and strategic leaders. This means designing and running experiments in your first quarter at DoorDash, quickly becoming a SQL expert, developing your data storytelling abilities, and working alongside seasoned data scientists who will guide you in developing necessary skills on the job. As a Data Analyst at DoorDash, you'll use your quantitative reasoning skills to dive into large datasets to guide decision-making. We tackle a multitude of exciting challenges including customer acquisition, fraud, and support, marketing, balancing supply and demand, new city launches, marketplace efficiency, and more. If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos and want to learn how to use analytics to affect revenue, growth, operations, or beyond, we’re looking for someone like you!

You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…

Get your start in Analytics and learn the ropes from seasoned Data Scientists. You’ll have important problems to solve from day one.
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business.
Own the end-to-end experimentation process from opportunity identification and experimentation design to analyzing results and recommending next steps.
Build full-cycle analytics experiments, reports, and dashboards using SQL, R, Python, or other scripting and statistical tools.
Produce recommendations and use exploratory data analysis techniques to validate your findings.
Provide insights to help business and product leaders understand marketplace dynamics, user behaviors, and long-term trends.
Identify and measure product and business levers to focus our roadmap on moving key metrics
Work backward from understanding and sizing problems to ideating solutions
Report against our goals by identifying essential metrics and building executive-facing dashboards to track progress
Collaborate with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging
Be a part of DoorDash’s first entry-level Analytics program!

We’re Excited About You Because…

A degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Biology, Chemistry, or equivalent exposure to a quantitative domain
Curiosity about our business and products, and how we can improve them using data, analysis, and experimentation
High-level understanding of analytical concepts like funnel optimization, user segmentation, cohort analyses, time series analyses, regression models, etc
Basic knowledge of a data or scripting language (e.g., SQL, Python, R, matlab, etc.) and the desire to quickly develop mastery of SQL
Basic working knowledge of data manipulation and visualization techniques
Familiarity with statistical concepts related to experiment design, hypothesis testing, and predictive modeling
The insight to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way
The determination to initiate and lead projects to completion in a scrappy environment
Prior experience, including internships, in data analytics, consulting, or related quantitative role is a plus but not required

Why You’ll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders – Leadership is not limited to our management team. It’s something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.

We are operators – We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions to lead our company and our industry is what we do on every project, every day.

We are learners – Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we’ve been in a role for one year or one minute. We are committed to learning and implementing what is best for our customers, merchants, and dashers.

We are one team – The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.

About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly and always learn and reiterate to support merchants, Dashers and the communities we serve. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods. Read more on the DoorDash website, the DoorDash blog, the DoorDash Engineering blog, and the DoorDash Careers page.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. Our leaders seek the truth and welcome big, hairy, audacious questions. We are grounded in our company values, and we make intentional decisions that are both logical and display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to Merchants to Customers.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, the base salary range in Colorado for this position is $86,000 to $129,000 per year, plus opportunities for equity and commission. Compensation in other geographies may vary. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel. Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

title: Analyst, Data Insights
industries: Entertainment
description:
Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.

Join us. Shape your story here.

THE JOB

The Distribution Analytics & Insights team is responsible for developing analyses to enable strategic and operational decision-making across WarnerMedia’s streaming brands, TV networks and licensed content distribution channels. This role will work closely with various stakeholders to help drive growth in HBO Max subscriptions and revenues across the global app platforms as well as pay-tv and broadband distributors. The Analyst will collaborate across the WarnerMedia organization to identify opportunities, report on business and industry trends, and help facilitate access to data and insights.

Primary Responsibilities

Works with the team and other WM stakeholders to develop analyses in support of HBO Max and other content distribution strategies by identifying emerging patterns in subscription and engagement behaviors.
Assists in building customer lifecycle and content valuation models, leveraging disparate data sources across multiple touchpoints and brands.
Upholds a ‘test and learn’ approach for new research initiatives by developing analytic plans to ensure accurate and robust results. Presents findings to key stakeholders along with strategic implications and recommendations.
Collaborates with various teams to align on data and methodologies. Develops dashboards in data visualization tools (e.g., Looker) to ensure that business reporting needs are met.
Takes on project management role in supporting the company’s data and analytics initiatives, including ongoing coordination across various teams.
Acts as a subject matter expert on consumer behavioral trends and competitive intelligence, translates to WM where applicable, and shares findings with internal stakeholders.
Cultivates and manages relationships with internal stakeholders. Facilitates the constant flow of information between teams critical to the day-to-day business.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required. Concentration in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Economics preferred.
2+ years of experience in an analytics role preferred.
Proficiency in working with large analytic datasets using SQL. Experience with visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
Analytical, numerate and motivated. Comfort with ambiguity and managing multiple projects simutaneously.
Expertise with Excel & PowerPoint. Experience using VBA and/or macros is a plus.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex methodologies and nuanced results into easy-to-understand insights using a storytelling approach.

The Perks

Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
Access to in-house learning and development resources
Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

title: Data Privacy Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Software, and Financial Services
description:
Req ID: 157777

NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Data Privacy Analyst to join our team in Plano, Texas (US-TX), United States (US).

Data Privacy Analyst – Position Description

The person in this role will support and assist from an operational perspective the implementation of the Company’s global data protection and privacy framework, applicable policies and procedures, and the related governance operating model. Such person should possess a practical understanding of data privacy requirements associated with such a role. The individual performing such role must have the ability to engage with other business and technology teams in order to assist with the implementing of corporate data privacy practices and procedures. Strong preference for candidates with experience with the OneTrust data privacy application.

Such person will work closely and collaboratively with the Data Privacy Operational Lead. The person in this role needs to have a broad knowledge of the operational aspects of computer software and hardware. Must be able to convey technical language to other stakeholders often in non-technical terms. The person in such role must likewise be collaborative, inquisitive, and have strong organizational skills, the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision, and the ability to handle large volumes of work in a highly matrixed organization. Such individual must further possess an “ownership mentality,” but simultaneously thrive as part of a team.

Depending on the candidate’s skill and experience, responsibilities may eventually expand to cover more strategic and additional responsibilities. This position reports to the Data Privacy Operational Lead and is available immediately.

The duties of the position include but are not limited to the following:

Take the lead in managing the Company’s OneTrust Data Privacy tool by launching and tracking open assessments, running reports, responding to inquiries as to how the tool operates and be responsible for updating the data elements tied to assessments as needed.
Ability to understand the technical aspects of applications and systems in order to assist as needed with data privacy assessments.
Assist with developing and delivering training for responders to Data Privacy Assessments.
Perform the initial review all data privacy assessments for valid and completeness of responses.
Ability to implement new assessment templates within the OneTrust data privacy tool.
Assist with gathering information from various internal teams associated with personal data flows in order to facilitate development of processing activity data maps.
Support data subject request data gathering activities
Assist with updating schedules to the various group transfer agreements
Manage invoicing associated with data privacy matters in legal matter management system.

Requirements For The Position

College degree required with 1 to 3 years in the information technology industry preferred.
1 to 2 years data privacy experience preferred or demonstrated basic understanding of data privacy compliance.
Broad understanding of information technology services and technical aspects of applications
Ability to participate in multiple work streams in a resource-constrained environment.
Problem-solving skills, professionalism and integrity necessary in order to be privy to sensitive, confidential, complex data protection/privacy issues.
Ability to work collaboratively with members of the legal team, information security team, compliance team to advance the Privacy Program goals and objectives projects and initiatives.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills: ability to manage and prioritize many tasks to deliver timely, high-quality work.

Basic Minimum Requirements

College degree required
1 to 2 years data privacy experience or demonstrated basic understanding of data privacy compliance.

INDSALES

About NTT DATA Services

NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.

Advance Data Analytics and Services (ADA) Team is a group within Risk Modeling and Analytics (RMA) Organization, responsible for developing libraries, models, and applications centered around the in-house big data platform. The team works closely with Risk technology and the RMA analytical model teams to leverage big-data modelling and solutions to complement the core modelling work. The team applies expertise across data management, cloud architecture and risk analytics to streamline the risk management processes. The initial scope of the work is on FRTB, providing tools and solutions to facilitate validation by model sponsors, reporting, understanding, and what-if analysis. title: Data Annotation Analyst
industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Help us grow into an ever-evolving marketplace. Seeking a reliable and organized Data Annotation Analyst!

What We Do

Betterview, a San Francisco and San Diego-based company building insight through aerial imagery and machine learning, is looking for a [Job Title] to help tell the world about its industry-leading Enterprise SaaS platform.

Every day, our team is focused on the needs of our customers. We strive to earn their trust by providing valuable, accurate insight that is important to their businesses. We provide our customers with information that is not only useful to their business decisions but is easy to use. We combine high quality human interactions with sleek, intuitive design and are pioneers on the journey alongside our customers, who are transforming the way they do business with data-driven decision-making.

THE OPPORTUNITYBetterview’s Machine Vision team maintains an ever-expanding suite of computer vision models to detect property conditions and identify risk factors using aerial imagery. A model is only as good as the data it’s trained on, and that’s why we’re looking for a reliable and organized Data Annotation Analyst to help curate and expand our library of training data.

Reporting to the Data Annotation Manager, the Data Annotation Analyst will support Betterview’s data labeling operations that enable us to continually expand and enrich our training datasets. For example, if Betterview were looking for more imagery containing solar panels on a roof, the Data Annotation team supports these efforts by creating a dataset in which every image in the dataset contains a clean example of solar panels. Typically this will entail reviewing/cleaning data, preparing it for outside labeling.

What You Will Be Doing

Supporting data labeling projects both internally and in coordination with vendors to support Betterview’s machine vision roadmap
Reviewing imagery to:
Measure annotation quality (QA)
Find and rectify mislabeled imagery (data curation)
Uncover model weaknesses that can be addressed with more data (model improvement)
Processing and transforming imagery and labels to ingest it into machine learning workflows
Contributing to continual improvement of data labeling pipeline with Data Annotation Manager
Creating and maintaining modular library of data labeling instructions for all supported classes, and expand as needed to support expansion of Betterview’s product suite
Cultivating deep knowledge of Betterview’s machine vision data and leverage it to mine suitable candidates for data labeling at a large scale
Identifying opportunities for improvement of methods and processes to ensure data quality and consistency
Identifying opportunities for improvement in Betterview’s data and, together with machine vision colleagues, working to implement solutions
Creating and maintaining internal reports to track quality and size of training datasets over time
Updating tasks in Jira and keep good notes


What You Will Bring To Our Company

Experienced in SQL at the level of an analyst
Mastery of Google Enterprise Suite (Docs, Drive, Sheets)
Excellent organization and project management skills
Strong attention to detail and data hygiene habits


The successful candidate:

Has an analytical mind and a strong nose for data issues
Has strong initiative, accountability, and is a self starter
Has an interest in data science, machine learning and/or computer vision
Has some familiarity with Python/Jupyter Notebooks a plus


What We Provide

Compensation commensurate with experience.
Generous health benefits – medical, dental and vision.
Medical offerings include PPO, HMO, and HDHP options through Kaiser and Blue Shield.
Betterview covers 75% of the sponsored medical plan employee premium, 60% of dependents.
For dental and vision, Betterview covers 75% of the employee premium, 50% of dependents.
401(k) Retirement Plan.
Betterview matches 100% of employee contributions up to the first 3% of pay, then 50% of employee contributions on the next 2% of pay.
FSA and HSA.
10 paid holidays.
Full-time employees receive 160 hours per year of paid time off; part-time employees accrue PTO on a pro-rated basis.
Charity contribution match, up to $100.
Cell phone reimbursement.
Professional development reimbursement.
Commuter benefits.


COVID Vaccine is required as a condition of employment with Betterview. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.

Betterview provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetics, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. In addition to federal law requirements, Betterview complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Betterview will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

Betterview will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law. If you’re applying for a position in San Francisco, review the guidelines applicable in your area.

Betterview expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Betterview employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to complete this application, please let us know by contacting HR(at)Betterview(dot)com.

title: Legal Data Analyst
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Financial Services
description:
Thinking about an alternative legal career? Bloomberg Law offers an opportunity to advance and develop your legal career through a distinctive, non-traditional path. This role allows you to blend your passion for the law with technology, business, and data analysis. Bloomberg Law is dependent upon our legal data analysts to use their legal domain knowledge, critical thinking and strategic approach to build excellent products.

As a member of the Legal Data Analysis team, you will align closely with both our business and engineering teams to help drive product development and ensure data accuracy in Bloomberg Law"s initiatives. We apply our robust legal domain knowledge, project management skills and sharp attention to detail to annotate, analyze and evaluate legal datasets including court opinions, court briefs and contractual provisions. The team's work is critical in supporting feature developments that use artificial intelligence and machine learning including Points of Law, Brief Analyzer and Draft Analyzer. This role will give the opportunity to display your enthusiasm, problem-solving and organizational skills, ability to collaborate, and flexibility in pivoting between projects in a fast-paced environment. This position can be located in either New York or Princeton NJ.

What's in it for you:

Contribute to the Bloomberg Law platform by supporting the development of new technology-driven solutions for the legal professionals.
You"ll belong to a team responsible for management of data tagging and evaluation of model outputs as well as user acceptance testing, vendor management, and quality assurance, among other things.
You"ll build relationships through Bloomberg's dynamic and collaborative environment where you will work with engineering, among others, to ensure proper understanding of an attorney"s workflow and validate product builds.
We"ll invest in you, and coupled with our individualized approach to career development, we will help you expand your skills and opportunities.

You"ll need to have:

Graduated with a Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school.
Passed a state Bar examination and been admitted.
Minimum of 1-3 years relevant practice experience.
Familiarity with online legal research tools. Experience with the BLAW product is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including sophisticated concepts effectively.
Strong project management, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Self-starter and the ability to work with a high-degree of autonomy.
Interest in technology and development of technical skills.
Legal authorization to work in the US without visa sponsorship now and in the future.

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Bloomberg is committed to diversity. It drives our innovation. At Bloomberg, you'll have the opportunity to go above and beyond and to take risks. You'll be a part of an organization that is entering new markets, launching new ventures, and pushing boundaries. Our ever-expanding array of technology, data, news, and media services champions innovation and empowers clients -- and offers nearly limitless opportunities for career growth.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We bring out the best in each other.

title: Researcher & Data Analyst, Fine Arts
industries: Artists and Writers, Beverage Manufacturing, and Luxury Goods and Jewelry
description:
About Sotheby's

Established in 1744, Sotheby’s is the world’s premier destination for art and luxury. Synonymous with innovation, Sotheby’s promotes access, connoisseurship and preservation of fine art and rare objects through auctions, private sales and retail locations. Our trusted global marketplace is supported by a network of specialists spanning 40 countries and 50 categories, which include Contemporary Art, Modern and Impressionist Art, Old Masters, Chinese Works of Art, Jewelry, Watches, Wine and Spirits, and Interiors, among many others.

THE ROLE

Working as part of a centralized Research Team in the heart of Sotheby’s Technology and Product Group under the Data division, reporting to the London Data Transformation Manager. This individual will be responsible for the data reformatting and consolidation of intelligence on the property database. It is their responsibility to ensure the highest standard of data quality and data integrity at all time.

Responsibilities

Working mainly on internal data, you will be meticulous and accurate in the reformatting of the necessary information.
Clean and centralize internal systems data on Excel:
Reformat and standardize the requested amount of data every day
Follow internal guidelines thoroughly
Monitor your own work, meet targets and regularly report to senior researcher
Communicate any questions or tips to the team to always improve guidelines
Other tasks will involve:
Gathering intelligence from external sources for specific artist projects
Researching the full market history and current ownerships of works of art
Entering new intelligence to expand the database
Data maintenance & updates

Ideal Experience & Competencies

Exceptional Excel proficiency: you can demonstrate strong Excel knowledge and skills
Prior data analyst experience strongly preferred
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
Proficiency with MS, Outlook, Slack, Google tools and general familiarity with database management (knowledge of Sotheby’s systems is a plus)
Flexibility to work long hours, including evenings, weekends and deadline periods
Ability to work under high pressure, perform multiple tasks simultaneously and meet targets
Ability to troubleshoot and solve problematic situations on a regular basis
Discreet, dependable and mature
Enthusiasm about art and willingness to broaden knowledge
